ReferenceBlocks.text: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don't withhold your coat also.

block.text: Barangsiapa menampar pipimu yang satu, berikanlah juga kepadanya pipimu yang lain, dan barangsiapa yang mengambil jubahmu, biarkan juga ia mengambil bajumu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and don't ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.”

block.text: Berilah kepada setiap orang yang meminta kepadamu; dan janganlah meminta kembali kepada orang yang mengambil kepunyaanmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.

block.text: Dan sebagaimana kamu kehendaki supaya orang perbuat kepadamu, perbuatlah juga demikian kepada mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.

block.text: <<Dan jikalau kamu mengasihi orang yang mengasihi kamu, apakah jasamu? Karena orang-orang berdosapun mengasihi juga orang-orang yang mengasihi mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.

block.text: Sebab jikalau kamu berbuat baik kepada orang yang berbuat baik kepada kamu, apakah jasamu? Orang-orang berdosapun berbuat demikian.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.

block.text: <<Dan jikalau kamu meminjamkan sesuatu kepada orang, karena kamu berharap akan menerima sesuatu dari padanya, apakah jasamu? Orang-orang berdosapun meminjamkan kepada orang-orang berdosa, supaya mereka menerima kembali sama banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.

block.text: Tetapi kamu, kasihilah musuhmu dan berbuatlah baik kepada mereka dan pinjamkan dengan tidak mengharapkan balasan, maka upahmu akan besar dan kamu akan menjadi anak-anak Allah Yang Mahatinggi, sebab Ia baik terhadap orang-orang yang tidak tahu berterima kasih dan terhadap orang-orang jahat

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.

block.text: Hendaklah kamu murah hati, sama seperti Bapamu adalah murah hati.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't judge, and you won't be judged. Don't condemn, and you won't be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free.”

block.text: <<Janganlah kamu menghakimi, maka kamupun tidak akan dihakimi. Dan janganlah kamu menghukum, maka kamupun tidak akan dihukum; ampunilah dan kamu akan diampuni.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”

block.text: Berilah dan kamu akan diberi: suatu takaran yang baik, yang dipadatkan, yang digoncang dan yang tumpah ke luar akan dicurahkan ke dalam ribaanmu. Sebab ukuran yang kamu pakai untuk mengukur, akan diukurkan kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke a parable to them.

block.text: Yesus mengatakan pula suatu perumpamaan kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can the blind guide the blind? Won't they both fall into a pit?

block.text: <<Dapatkah orang buta menuntun orang buta? Bukankah keduanya akan jatuh ke dalam lobang?

ReferenceBlocks.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.

block.text: Seorang murid tidak lebih dari pada gurunya, tetapi barangsiapa yang telah tamat pelajarannya akan sama dengan gurunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye, but don't consider the beam that is in your own eye?

block.text: Mengapakah engkau melihat selumbar di dalam mata saudaramu, sedangkan balok di dalam matamu sendiri tidak engkau ketahui?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don't see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye.

block.text: Bagaimanakah engkau dapat berkata kepada saudaramu: Saudara, biarlah aku mengeluarkan selumbar yang ada di dalam matamu, padahal balok yang di dalam matamu tidak engkau lihat? Hai orang munafik, keluarkanlah dahulu balok dari matamu, maka engkau akan melihat dengan jelas untuk mengeluarkan selumbar itu dari mata saudaramu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is no good tree that brings forth rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that brings forth good fruit.

block.text: <<Karena tidak ada pohon yang baik yang menghasilkan buah yang tidak baik, dan juga tidak ada pohon yang tidak baik yang menghasilkan buah yang baik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don't gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.

block.text: Sebab setiap pohon dikenal pada buahnya. Karena dari semak duri orang tidak memetik buah ara dan dari duri-duri tidak memetik buah anggur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.”

block.text: Orang yang baik mengeluarkan barang yang baik dari perbendaharaan hatinya yang baik dan orang yang jahat mengeluarkan barang yang jahat dari perbendaharaannya yang jahat. Karena yang diucapkan mulutnya, meluap dari hatinya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don't do the things which I say?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu berseru kepada-Ku: <Tuhan, Tuhan,> padahal kamu tidak melakukan apa yang Aku katakan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.

block.text: Setiap orang yang datang kepada-Ku dan mendengarkan perkataan-Ku serta melakukannya—Aku akan menyatakan kepadamu dengan siapa ia dapat disamakan—,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.

block.text: ia sama dengan seorang yang mendirikan rumah: Orang itu menggali dalam-dalam dan meletakkan dasarnya di atas batu. Ketika datang air bah dan banjir melanda rumah itu, rumah itu tidak dapat digoyahkan, karena rumah itu kokoh dibangun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who hears, and doesn't do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

block.text: Akan tetapi barangsiapa mendengar perkataan-Ku, tetapi tidak melakukannya, ia sama dengan seorang yang mendirikan rumah di atas tanah tanpa dasar. Ketika banjir melandanya, rumah itu segera rubuh dan hebatlah kerusakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 7
After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

block.text: Setelah Yesus selesai berbicara di depan orang banyak, masuklah Ia ke Kapernaum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain centurion's servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.

block.text: Di situ ada seorang perwira yang mempunyai seorang hamba, yang sangat dihargainya. Hamba itu sedang sakit keras dan hampir mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.

block.text: Ketika perwira itu mendengar tentang Yesus, ia menyuruh beberapa orang tua-tua Yahudi kepada-Nya untuk meminta, supaya Ia datang dan menyembuhkan hambanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying,

block.text: Mereka datang kepada Yesus dan dengan sangat mereka meminta pertolongan-Nya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is worthy for you to do this for him,
for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”

block.text: <<Ia layak Engkau tolong,
sebab ia mengasihi bangsa kita dan dialah yang menanggung pembangunan rumah ibadat kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him,

block.text: Lalu Yesus pergi bersama-sama dengan mereka. Ketika Ia tidak jauh lagi dari rumah perwira itu, perwira itu menyuruh sahabat-sahabatnya untuk mengatakan kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don't trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.

block.text: <<Tuan, janganlah bersusah-susah, sebab aku tidak layak menerima Tuan di dalam rumahku;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I didn't even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.

block.text: sebab itu aku juga menganggap diriku tidak layak untuk datang kepada-Mu. Tetapi katakan saja sepatah kata, maka hambaku itu akan sembuh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

block.text: Sebab aku sendiri seorang bawahan, dan di bawahku ada pula prajurit. Jika aku berkata kepada salah seorang prajurit itu: <Pergi!,> maka ia pergi, dan kepada seorang lagi: <Datang!,> maka ia datang, ataupun kepada hambaku: <Kerjakanlah> ini!, maka ia mengerjakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him,

block.text: Setelah Yesus mendengar perkataan itu, Ia heran akan dia, dan sambil berpaling kepada orang banyak yang mengikuti Dia, Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, iman sebesar ini tidak pernah Aku jumpai, sekalipun di antara orang Israel!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.

block.text: Dan setelah orang-orang yang disuruh itu kembali ke rumah, didapatinyalah hamba itu telah sehat kembali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened soon afterwards, that he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.

block.text: Kemudian Yesus pergi ke suatu kota yang bernama Nain. Murid-murid-Nya pergi bersama-sama dengan Dia, dan juga orang banyak menyertai-Nya berbondong-bondong.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.

block.text: Setelah Ia dekat pintu gerbang kota, ada orang mati diusung ke luar, anak laki-laki, anak tunggal ibunya yang sudah janda, dan banyak orang dari kota itu menyertai janda itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her,

block.text: Dan ketika Tuhan melihat janda itu, tergeraklah hati-Nya oleh belas kasihan, lalu Ia berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't cry.”

block.text: <<Jangan menangis!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said,

block.text: Sambil menghampiri usungan itu Ia menyentuhnya, dan sedang para pengusung berhenti, Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Young man, I tell you, arise!”

block.text: <<Hai anak muda, Aku berkata kepadamu, bangkitlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young man who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And Jesus returned him to his mother saying:

block.text: Maka bangunlah orang itu dan duduk dan mulai berkata-kata, dan Yesus

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive your son.”

block.text: menyerahkannya kepada ibunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying,

block.text: Semua orang itu ketakutan dan mereka memuliakan Allah, sambil berkata:

block.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “A great prophet has arisen among us!”

block.text: <<Seorang nabi besar telah muncul di tengah-tengah kita,>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and,

block.text: dan

block.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “God has visited his people!”

block.text: <<Allah telah melawat umat-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region.

block.text: Maka tersiarlah kabar tentang Yesus di seluruh Yudea dan di seluruh daerah sekitarnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples of John told him about all these things.

block.text: Ketika Yohanes mendapat kabar tentang segala peristiwa itu dari murid-muridnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying,

block.text: ia memanggil dua orang dari antaranya dan menyuruh mereka bertanya kepada Tuhan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”

block.text: <<Engkaukah yang akan datang itu atau haruskah kami menantikan seorang lain?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the men had come to him, they said,

block.text: Ketika kedua orang itu sampai kepada Yesus, mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’”

block.text: <<Yohanes Pembaptis menyuruh kami bertanya kepada-Mu: <Engkaukah yang akan datang itu atau haruskah kami menantikan seorang lain?> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: Pada saat itu Yesus menyembuhkan banyak orang dari segala penyakit dan penderitaan dan dari roh-roh jahat, dan Ia mengaruniakan penglihatan kepada banyak orang buta.
Dan Yesus menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

block.text: <<Pergilah, dan katakanlah kepada Yohanes apa yang kamu lihat dan kamu dengar: Orang buta melihat, orang lumpuh berjalan, orang kusta menjadi tahir, orang tuli mendengar, orang mati dibangkitkan dan kepada orang miskin diberitakan kabar baik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

block.text: Dan berbahagialah orang yang tidak menjadi kecewa dan menolak Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When John's messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John,

block.text: Setelah suruhan Yohanes itu pergi, mulailah Yesus berbicara kepada orang banyak itu tentang Yohanes:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

block.text: <<Untuk apakah kamu pergi ke padang gurun? Melihat buluh yang digoyangkan angin kian ke mari?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

block.text: Atau untuk apakah kamu pergi? Melihat orang yang berpakaian halus? Orang yang berpakaian indah dan yang hidup mewah, tempatnya di istana raja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

block.text: Jadi untuk apakah kamu pergi? Melihat nabi? Benar, dan Aku berkata kepadamu, bahkan lebih dari pada nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’”

block.text: Karena tentang dia ada tertulis: <Lihatlah, Aku menyuruh utusan-Ku mendahului Engkau, ia akan mempersiapkan jalan-Mu di hadapan-Mu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in the Kingdom of God is greater than he.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Di antara mereka yang dilahirkan oleh perempuan tidak ada seorangpun yang lebih besar dari pada Yohanes, namun yang terkecil dalam Kerajaan Allah lebih besar dari padanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John's baptism.

block.text: Seluruh orang banyak yang mendengar perkataan-Nya, termasuk para pemungut cukai, mengakui kebenaran Allah, karena mereka telah memberi diri dibaptis oleh Yohanes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.

block.text: Tetapi orang-orang Farisi dan ahli-ahli Taurat menolak maksud Allah terhadap diri mereka, karena mereka tidak mau dibaptis oleh Yohanes.
Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?

block.text: <<Dengan apakah akan Kuumpamakan orang-orang dari angkatan ini dan dengan apakah mereka itu sama?

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call one to another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn't dance. We mourned, and you didn't weep.’

block.text: Mereka itu seumpama anak-anak yang duduk di pasar dan yang saling menyerukan: <Kami meniup seruling bagimu, tetapi kamu tidak menari, kami menyanyikan kidung duka, tetapi kamu tidak menangis.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

block.text: Karena Yohanes Pembaptis datang, ia tidak makan roti dan tidak minum anggur, dan kamu berkata: <Ia kerasukan setan.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

block.text: Kemudian Anak Manusia datang, Ia makan dan minum, dan kamu berkata: <Lihatlah, Ia seorang pelahap dan peminum, sahabat pemungut cukai dan orang berdosa.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”

block.text: Tetapi hikmat dibenarkan oleh semua orang yang menerimanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee's house, and sat at the table.

block.text: Seorang Farisi mengundang Yesus untuk datang makan di rumahnya. Yesus datang ke rumah orang Farisi itu, lalu duduk makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee's house, she brought an alabaster jar of ointment.

block.text: Di kota itu ada seorang perempuan yang terkenal sebagai seorang berdosa. Ketika perempuan itu mendengar, bahwa Yesus sedang makan di rumah orang Farisi itu, datanglah ia membawa sebuah buli-buli pualam berisi minyak wangi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

block.text: Sambil menangis ia pergi berdiri di belakang Yesus dekat kaki-Nya, lalu membasahi kaki-Nya itu dengan air matanya dan menyekanya dengan rambutnya, kemudian ia mencium kaki-Nya dan meminyakinya dengan minyak wangi itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself,

block.text: Ketika orang Farisi yang mengundang Yesus melihat hal itu, ia berkata dalam hatinya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”

block.text: <<Jika Ia ini nabi, tentu Ia tahu, siapakah dan orang apakah perempuan yang menjamah-Nya ini; tentu Ia tahu, bahwa perempuan itu adalah seorang berdosa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, I have something to tell you.”

block.text: <<Simon, ada yang hendak Kukatakan kepadamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Sahut Simon:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me teacher,”

block.text: <<Katakanlah, Guru.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus replied:

block.text: Jawab Yesus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

block.text: <<Ada dua orang yang berhutang kepada seorang pelepas uang. Yang seorang berhutang lima ratus dinar, yang lain lima puluh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they couldn't pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”

block.text: Karena mereka tidak sanggup membayar, maka ia menghapuskan hutang kedua orang itu. Siapakah di antara mereka yang akan terlebih mengasihi dia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon answered,

block.text: Jawab Simon:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.”

block.text: <<Aku kira dia yang paling banyak dihapuskan hutangnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have judged correctly.”

block.text: <<Betul pendapatmu itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon,

block.text: Dan sambil berpaling kepada perempuan itu, Ia berkata kepada Simon:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.

block.text: <<Engkau lihat perempuan ini? Aku masuk ke rumahmu, namun engkau tidak memberikan Aku air untuk membasuh kaki-Ku, tetapi dia membasahi kaki-Ku dengan air mata dan menyekanya dengan rambutnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.

block.text: Engkau tidak mencium Aku, tetapi sejak Aku masuk ia tiada henti-hentinya mencium kaki-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You didn't anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.

block.text: Engkau tidak meminyaki kepala-Ku dengan minyak, tetapi dia meminyaki kaki-Ku dengan minyak wangi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”

block.text: Sebab itu Aku berkata kepadamu: Dosanya yang banyak itu telah diampuni, sebab ia telah banyak berbuat kasih. Tetapi orang yang sedikit diampuni, sedikit juga ia berbuat kasih.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to her,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your sins are forgiven.”

block.text: <<Dosamu telah diampuni.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves,

block.text: Dan mereka, yang duduk makan bersama Dia, berpikir dalam hati mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

block.text: <<Siapakah Ia ini, sehingga Ia dapat mengampuni dosa?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the woman,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata kepada perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

block.text: <<Imanmu telah menyelamatkan engkau, pergilah dengan selamat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 8
It happened soon afterwards, that he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of the Kingdom of God. With him were the twelve,

block.text: Tidak lama sesudah itu Yesus berjalan berkeliling dari kota ke kota dan dari desa ke desa memberitakan Injil Kerajaan Allah. Kedua belas murid-Nya bersama-sama dengan Dia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

block.text: dan juga beberapa orang perempuan yang telah disembuhkan dari roh-roh jahat atau berbagai penyakit, yaitu Maria yang disebut Magdalena, yang telah dibebaskan dari tujuh roh jahat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod's steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.

block.text: Yohana isteri Khuza bendahara Herodes, Susana dan banyak perempuan lain. Perempuan-perempuan ini melayani rombongan itu dengan kekayaan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.

block.text: Ketika orang banyak berbondong-bondong datang, yaitu orang-orang yang dari kota ke kota menggabungkan diri pada Yesus, berkatalah Ia dalam suatu perumpamaan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.

block.text: <<Adalah seorang penabur keluar untuk menaburkan benihnya. Pada waktu ia menabur, sebagian benih itu jatuh di pinggir jalan, lalu diinjak orang dan burung-burung di udara memakannya sampai habis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

block.text: Sebagian jatuh di tanah yang berbatu-batu, dan setelah tumbuh ia menjadi kering karena tidak mendapat air.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.

block.text: Sebagian lagi jatuh di tengah semak duri, dan semak itu tumbuh bersama-sama dan menghimpitnya sampai mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and brought forth fruit one hundred times.”

block.text: Dan sebagian jatuh di tanah yang baik, dan setelah tumbuh berbuah seratus kali lipat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he said these things, he called out,

block.text: Setelah berkata demikian Yesus berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”

block.text: <<Siapa mempunyai telinga untuk mendengar, hendaklah ia mendengar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then his disciples asked him,

block.text: Murid-murid-Nya bertanya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this parable mean?”

block.text: kepada-Nya, apa maksud perumpamaan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Lalu Ia menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’

block.text: <<Kepadamu diberi karunia untuk mengetahui rahasia Kerajaan Allah, tetapi kepada orang-orang lain hal itu diberitakan dalam perumpamaan, supaya sekalipun memandang, mereka tidak melihat dan sekalipun mendengar, mereka tidak mengerti.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

block.text: <<Inilah arti perumpamaan itu: Benih itu ialah firman Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

block.text: Yang jatuh di pinggir jalan itu ialah orang yang telah mendengarnya; kemudian datanglah Iblis lalu mengambil firman itu dari dalam hati mereka, supaya mereka jangan percaya dan diselamatkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.

block.text: Yang jatuh di tanah yang berbatu-batu itu ialah orang, yang setelah mendengar firman itu, menerimanya dengan gembira, tetapi mereka itu tidak berakar, mereka percaya sebentar saja dan dalam masa pencobaan mereka murtad.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.

block.text: <<Yang jatuh dalam semak duri ialah orang yang telah mendengar firman itu, dan dalam pertumbuhan selanjutnya mereka terhimpit oleh kekuatiran dan kekayaan dan kenikmatan hidup, sehingga mereka tidak menghasilkan buah yang matang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That in the good ground, these are such as in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and bring forth fruit with patience.”

block.text: Yang jatuh di tanah yang baik itu ialah orang, yang setelah mendengar firman itu, menyimpannya dalam hati yang baik dan mengeluarkan buah dalam ketekunan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.

block.text: <<Tidak ada orang yang menyalakan pelita lalu menutupinya dengan tempayan atau menempatkannya di bawah tempat tidur, tetapi ia menempatkannya di atas kaki dian, supaya semua orang yang masuk ke dalam rumah dapat melihat cahayanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.

block.text: Sebab tidak ada sesuatu yang tersembunyi yang tidak akan dinyatakan, dan tidak ada sesuatu yang rahasia yang tidak akan diketahui dan diumumkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn't have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”

block.text: Karena itu, perhatikanlah cara kamu mendengar. Karena siapa yang mempunyai, kepadanya akan diberi, tetapi siapa yang tidak mempunyai, dari padanya akan diambil, juga apa yang ia anggap ada padanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.

block.text: Ibu dan saudara-saudara Yesus datang kepada-Nya, tetapi mereka tidak dapat mencapai Dia karena orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was told him by some saying,

block.text: Orang memberitahukan kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”

block.text: <<Ibu-Mu dan saudara-saudara-Mu ada di luar dan ingin bertemu dengan Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tetapi Ia menjawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.”

block.text: <<Ibu-Ku dan saudara-saudara-Ku ialah mereka, yang mendengarkan firman Allah dan melakukannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it happened on one of those days, that he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them,

block.text: Pada suatu hari Yesus naik ke dalam perahu bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Nya, dan Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's go over to the other side of the lake.”

block.text: <<Marilah kita bertolak ke seberang danau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they launched out.
But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.

block.text: Lalu bertolaklah mereka.
Dan ketika mereka sedang berlayar, Yesus tertidur. Sekonyong-konyong turunlah taufan ke danau, sehingga perahu itu kemasukan air dan mereka berada dalam bahaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to him, and awoke him, saying,

block.text: Maka datanglah murid-murid-Nya membangunkan Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, master, we are dying!”

block.text: <<Guru, Guru, kita binasa!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.
He said to them,

block.text: Iapun bangun, lalu menghardik angin dan air yang mengamuk itu. Dan angin dan air itupun reda dan danau itu menjadi teduh.
Lalu kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is your faith?”

block.text: <<Di manakah kepercayaanmu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being afraid they marveled, saying one to another,

block.text: Maka takutlah mereka dan heran, lalu berkata seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this, then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”

block.text: <<Siapa gerangan orang ini, sehingga Ia memberi perintah kepada angin dan air dan mereka taat kepada-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.

block.text: Lalu mendaratlah Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya di tanah orang Gerasa yang terletak di seberang Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn't live in a house, but in the tombs.

block.text: Setelah Yesus naik ke darat, datanglah seorang laki-laki dari kota itu menemui Dia; orang itu dirasuki oleh setan-setan dan sudah lama ia tidak berpakaian dan tidak tinggal dalam rumah, tetapi dalam pekuburan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said,

block.text: Ketika ia melihat Yesus, ia berteriak lalu tersungkur di hadapan-Nya dan berkata dengan suara keras:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don't torment me!”

block.text: <<Apa urusan-Mu dengan aku, hai Yesus Anak Allah Yang Mahatinggi? Aku memohon kepada-Mu, supaya Engkau jangan menyiksa aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bands apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.
Jesus asked him,

block.text: Untuk Yesus memerintahkan roh jahat itu keluar dari orang itu. Untuk roh jahat sering merebut orang itu. Dia tetap di bawah penjagaan, dan diikat dengan rantai dan belenggu. Dia memecahkan band terpisah, ia didorong oleh setan itu ke padang pasir.
Yesus bertanya kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is your name?”

block.text: <<Siapakah namamu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawabnya:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Legion,”

block.text: <<Legion,>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: for many demons had entered into him.
They begged him, saying:

block.text: karena ia kerasukan banyak setan.
Lalu setan-setan itu memohon kepada Yesus, supaya Ia jangan memerintahkan

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not send us into the abyss!”

block.text: mereka masuk ke dalam jurang maut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain. The Demons begged Jesus, saying:

block.text: Adalah di sana sejumlah besar babi sedang mencari makan di lereng gunung, lalu setan-setan itu meminta kepada Yesus,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow us to enter into the pigs!”

block.text: supaya Ia memperkenankan mereka memasuki babi-babi itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He allowed them.

block.text: Yesus mengabulkan permintaan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The demons came out
from the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed
down the steep bank into the lake,
and were drowned.

block.text: Lalu keluarlah setan-setan itu
dari orang itu dan memasuki babi-babi itu. Kawanan babi itu terjun
dari tepi jurang ke dalam danau
lalu mati lemas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.

block.text: Setelah penjaga-penjaga babi itu melihat apa yang telah terjadi, mereka lari lalu menceritakan hal itu di kota dan di kampung-kampung sekitarnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

block.text: Dan keluarlah orang-orang untuk melihat apa yang telah terjadi. Mereka datang kepada Yesus dan mereka menjumpai orang yang telah ditinggalkan setan-setan itu duduk di kaki Yesus; ia telah berpakaian dan sudah waras. Maka takutlah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.

block.text: Orang-orang yang telah melihat sendiri hal itu memberitahukan kepada mereka, bagaimana orang yang dirasuk setan itu telah diselamatkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.

block.text: Lalu seluruh penduduk daerah Gerasa meminta kepada Yesus, supaya Ia meninggalkan mereka, sebab mereka sangat ketakutan. Maka naiklah Ia ke dalam perahu, lalu berlayar kembali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

block.text: Dan orang yang telah ditinggalkan setan-setan itu meminta supaya ia diperkenankan menyertai-Nya. Tetapi Yesus menyuruh dia pergi, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.”

block.text: <<Pulanglah ke rumahmu dan ceriterakanlah segala sesuatu yang telah diperbuat Allah atasmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.

block.text: Orang itupun pergi mengelilingi seluruh kota dan memberitahukan segala apa yang telah diperbuat Yesus atas dirinya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when Jesus returned, that the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.

block.text: Ketika Yesus kembali, orang banyak menyambut Dia sebab mereka semua menanti-nantikan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A ruler of the Synagogue named Jairus came and fell at Jesus's feet, and begged him, saying:

block.text: Maka datanglah seorang yang bernama Yairus. Ia adalah kepala rumah ibadat. Sambil tersungkur di depan kaki Yesus ia memohon kepada-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come to my house!”

block.text: supaya Yesus datang ke rumahnya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: for he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.

block.text: karena anaknya perempuan yang satu-satunya, yang berumur kira-kira dua belas tahun, hampir mati. Dalam perjalanan ke situ Yesus didesak-desak orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman was there who had a flow of blood for twelve years. She had spent all her living on physicians, and could not be healed by any.

block.text: Adalah seorang perempuan yang sudah dua belas tahun menderita pendarahan dan yang tidak berhasil disembuhkan oleh siapapun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak. Immediately the flow of her blood stopped.
Jesus said,

block.text: Ia maju mendekati Yesus dari belakang dan menjamah jumbai jubah-Nya, dan seketika itu juga berhentilah pendarahannya.
Lalu kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who touched me?”

block.text: <<Siapa yang menjamah Aku?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all denied it saying:

block.text: Dan karena tidak ada yang

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not I!”

block.text: mengakuinya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said:

block.text: berkatalah Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

block.text: <<Guru, orang banyak mengerumuni dan mendesak Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”

block.text: <<Ada seorang yang menjamah Aku, sebab Aku merasa ada kuasa keluar dari diri-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and fell down before him. She declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
He said to her,

block.text: Ketika perempuan itu melihat, bahwa perbuatannya itu ketahuan, ia datang dengan gemetar, Dia tersungkur di depan-Nya dan menceriterakan kepada orang banyak apa sebabnya ia menjamah Dia dan bahwa ia seketika itu juga menjadi sembuh.
Maka kata-Nya kepada perempuan itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”

block.text: <<Hai anak-Ku, imanmu telah menyelamatkan engkau, pergilah dengan selamat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue's house came, saying to him,

block.text: Ketika Yesus masih berbicara, datanglah seorang dari keluarga kepala rumah ibadat itu dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your daughter is dead. Don't trouble the Teacher.”

block.text: <<Anakmu sudah mati, jangan lagi engkau menyusah-nyusahkan Guru!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus hearing it, answered him,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mendengarnya dan berkata kepada Yairus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”

block.text: <<Jangan takut, percaya saja, dan anakmu akan selamat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the house, he didn't allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.

block.text: Setibanya di rumah Yairus, Yesus tidak memperbolehkan seorangpun ikut masuk dengan Dia, kecuali Petrus, Yohanes dan Yakobus dan ayah anak itu serta ibunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All were weeping and mourning her but he said,

block.text: Semua orang menangis dan meratapi anak itu. Akan tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't weep. She isn't dead, but sleeping.”

block.text: <<Jangan menangis; ia tidak mati, tetapi tidur.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were ridiculing
him, knowing that she was dead.

block.text: Mereka menertawakan
Dia, karena mereka tahu bahwa anak itu telah mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yesus memegang tangan anak itu dan berseru, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Child, arise!”

block.text: <<Hai anak bangunlah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Her spirit returned and she rose up immediately. Jesus told them:

block.text: Maka kembalilah roh anak itu dan seketika itu juga ia bangkit berdiri. Lalu Yesus menyuruh mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give her something to eat.”

block.text: memberi anak itu makan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them, saying:

block.text: Dan takjublah orang tua anak itu, tetapi Yesus melarang mereka memberitahukan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one what has been done.”

block.text: kepada siapapun juga apa yang terjadi itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 9
He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.

block.text: Maka Yesus memanggil kedua belas murid-Nya, lalu memberikan tenaga dan kuasa kepada mereka untuk menguasai setan-setan dan untuk menyembuhkan penyakit-penyakit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent them forth to preach the Kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
He said to them,

block.text: Dan Ia mengutus mereka untuk memberitakan Kerajaan Allah dan untuk menyembuhkan orang,
kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take nothing for your journey--neither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats apiece.

block.text: <<Jangan membawa apa-apa dalam perjalanan, jangan membawa tongkat atau bekal, roti atau uang, atau dua helai baju.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.

block.text: Dan apabila kamu sudah diterima dalam suatu rumah, tinggallah di situ sampai kamu berangkat dari situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As many as don't receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”

block.text: Dan kalau ada orang yang tidak mau menerima kamu, keluarlah dari kota mereka dan kebaskanlah debunya dari kakimu sebagai peringatan terhadap mereka.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News, and healing everywhere.

block.text: Lalu pergilah mereka dan mereka mengelilingi segala desa sambil memberitakan Injil dan menyembuhkan orang sakit di segala tempat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because some said:

block.text: Herodes, raja wilayah, mendengar segala yang terjadi itu dan iapun merasa cemas, sebab ada orang yang mengatakan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John had risen from the dead!”

block.text: bahwa Yohanes telah bangkit dari antara orang mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and others said,

block.text: Ada lagi yang mengatakan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah has appeared,”

block.text: bahwa Elia telah muncul kembali,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and still others said,

block.text: dan ada pula yang mengatakan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “One of the old prophets had risen again.”

block.text: bahwa seorang dari nabi-nabi dahulu telah bangkit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod said,

block.text: Tetapi Herodes berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John I beheaded, so who is this about whom I hear such things?”

block.text: <<Yohanes telah kupenggal kepalanya. Siapa gerangan Dia ini, yang kabarnya melakukan hal-hal demikian?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sought to see him.

block.text: Lalu ia berusaha supaya dapat bertemu dengan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a deserted place of a city called Bethsaida.

block.text: Sekembalinya rasul-rasul itu menceriterakan kepada Yesus apa yang telah mereka kerjakan. Lalu Yesus membawa mereka dan menyingkir ke sebuah kota yang bernama Betsaida, sehingga hanya mereka saja bersama Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, and spoke to them of the Kingdom of God, and he cured those who needed healing.

block.text: Akan tetapi orang banyak mengetahuinya, lalu mengikuti Dia. Ia menerima mereka dan berkata-kata kepada mereka tentang Kerajaan Allah dan Ia menyembuhkan orang-orang yang memerlukan penyembuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Late in the day the twelve came and said to him,

block.text: Pada waktu hari mulai malam datanglah kedua belas murid-Nya kepada-Nya dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”

block.text: <<Suruhlah orang banyak itu pergi, supaya mereka pergi ke desa-desa dan kampung-kampung sekitar ini untuk mencari tempat penginapan dan makanan, karena di sini kita berada di tempat yang sunyi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You give them something to eat.”

block.text: <<Kamu harus memberi mereka makan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Mereka menjawab:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”

block.text: <<Yang ada pada kami tidak lebih dari pada lima roti dan dua ikan, kecuali kalau kami pergi membeli makanan untuk semua orang banyak ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples,

block.text: Sebab di situ ada kira-kira lima ribu orang laki-laki. Lalu Ia berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”

block.text: <<Suruhlah mereka duduk berkelompok-kelompok, kira-kira lima puluh orang sekelompok.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They did so, and made them all sit down.

block.text: Murid-murid melakukannya dan menyuruh semua orang banyak itu duduk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.

block.text: Dan setelah Ia mengambil lima roti dan dua ikan itu, Ia menengadah ke langit, mengucap berkat, lalu memecah-mecahkan roti itu dan memberikannya kepada murid-murid-Nya supaya dibagi-bagikannya kepada orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: Dan mereka semuanya makan sampai kenyang. Kemudian dikumpulkan potongan-potongan roti yang sisa sebanyak dua belas bakul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as he was praying alone, that the disciples were with him, and he asked them,

block.text: Pada suatu kali ketika Yesus berdoa seorang diri, datanglah murid-murid-Nya kepada-Nya. Lalu Ia bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”

block.text: <<Kata orang banyak, siapakah Aku ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.”

block.text: <<Yohanes Pembaptis, ada juga yang mengatakan: Elia,>> <<ada pula yang mengatakan, bahwa seorang dari nabi-nabi dahulu telah bangkit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Yesus bertanya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: <<Menurut kamu, siapakah Aku ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered,

block.text: Jawab Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Christ of God.”

block.text: <<Mesias dari Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus commanded them, saying:

block.text: Lalu Yesus melarang mereka dengan keras, supaya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell this to no one!”

block.text: mereka jangan memberitahukan hal itu kepada siapapun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said:

block.text: Dan Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”

block.text: <<Anak Manusia harus menanggung banyak penderitaan dan ditolak oleh tua-tua, imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat, lalu dibunuh dan dibangkitkan pada hari ketiga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to all,

block.text: Kata-Nya kepada mereka semua:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: <<Setiap orang yang mau mengikut Aku, ia harus menyangkal dirinya, memikul salibnya setiap hari dan mengikut Aku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, the same will save it.

block.text: Karena barangsiapa mau menyelamatkan nyawanya, ia akan kehilangan nyawanya; tetapi barangsiapa kehilangan nyawanya karena Aku, ia akan menyelamatkannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?

block.text: Apa gunanya seorang memperoleh seluruh dunia, tetapi ia membinasakan atau merugikan dirinya sendiri?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

block.text: Sebab barangsiapa malu karena Aku dan karena perkataan-Ku, Anak Manusia juga akan malu karena orang itu, apabila Ia datang kelak dalam kemuliaan-Nya dan dalam kemuliaan Bapa dan malaikat-malaikat kudus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here, who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya di antara orang yang hadir di sini ada yang tidak akan mati sebelum mereka melihat Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened about eight days after these sayings, that he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.

block.text: Kira-kira delapan hari sesudah segala pengajaran itu, Yesus membawa Petrus, Yohanes dan Yakobus, lalu naik ke atas gunung untuk berdoa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.

block.text: Ketika Ia sedang berdoa, rupa wajah-Nya berubah dan pakaian-Nya menjadi putih berkilau-kilauan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two men, Moses and Elijah,
appeared in glorious splendor, and spoke with Jesus of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.

block.text: Dan tampaklah dua orang berbicara dengan Dia, yaitu Musa dan Elia.
Keduanya menampakkan diri dalam kemuliaan dan berbicara tentang tujuan kepergian-Nya yang akan digenapi-Nya di Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him.

block.text: Sementara itu Petrus dan teman-temannya telah tertidur dan ketika mereka terbangun mereka melihat Yesus dalam kemuliaan-Nya: dan kedua orang yang berdiri di dekat-Nya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as they were parting from him, that Peter said to Jesus,

block.text: Dan ketika kedua orang itu hendak meninggalkan Yesus, Petrus berkata kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let's make three tents: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,”

block.text: <<Guru, betapa bahagianya kami berada di tempat ini. Baiklah kami dirikan sekarang tiga kemah, satu untuk Engkau, satu untuk Musa dan satu untuk Elia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: not knowing what he said.
While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.

block.text: Tetapi Petrus tidak tahu apa yang dikatakannya itu.
Sementara ia berkata demikian, datanglah awan menaungi mereka. Dan ketika mereka masuk ke dalam awan itu, takutlah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came out of the cloud, saying,

block.text: Maka terdengarlah suara dari dalam awan itu, yang berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”

block.text: <<Inilah Anak-Ku yang Kupilih, dengarkanlah Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.

block.text: Ketika suara itu terdengar, nampaklah Yesus tinggal seorang diri. Dan murid-murid itu merahasiakannya, dan pada masa itu mereka tidak menceriterakan kepada siapapun apa yang telah mereka lihat itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a great multitude met him.

block.text: Pada keesokan harinya ketika mereka turun dari gunung itu, datanglah orang banyak berbondong-bondong menemui Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying,

block.text: Seorang dari orang banyak itu berseru, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.

block.text: <<Guru, aku memohon supaya Engkau menengok anakku, sebab ia adalah satu-satunya anakku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.

block.text: Sewaktu-waktu ia diserang roh, lalu mendadak ia berteriak dan roh itu menggoncang-goncangkannya sehingga mulutnya berbusa. Roh itu terus saja menyiksa dia dan hampir-hampir tidak mau meninggalkannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn't.”

block.text: Dan aku telah meminta kepada murid-murid-Mu supaya mereka mengusir roh itu, tetapi mereka tidak dapat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”

block.text: <<Hai kamu angkatan yang tidak percaya dan yang sesat, berapa lama lagi Aku harus tinggal di antara kamu dan sabar terhadap kamu? Bawa anakmu itu kemari!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.

block.text: Dan ketika anak itu mendekati Yesus, setan itu membantingkannya ke tanah dan menggoncang-goncangnya. Tetapi Yesus menegor roh jahat itu dengan keras dan menyembuhkan anak itu, lalu mengembalikannya kepada ayahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all astonished and said:

block.text: Maka takjublah semua orang itu

block.characterId: everyone who witnessed healing of boy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: everyone who witnessed healing of boy
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold the majesty of God!”

block.text: karena kebesaran Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But while all were marveling at all the things that Jesus did, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Ketika semua orang itu masih heran karena segala yang diperbuat-Nya itu, Yesus berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.”

block.text: <<Dengarlah dan camkanlah segala perkataan-Ku ini: Anak Manusia akan diserahkan ke dalam tangan manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn't understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.

block.text: Mereka tidak mengerti perkataan itu, sebab artinya tersembunyi bagi mereka, sehingga mereka tidak dapat memahaminya. Dan mereka tidak berani menanyakan arti perkataan itu kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There arose an argument among them about which of them was the greatest.

block.text: Maka timbullah pertengkaran di antara murid-murid Yesus tentang siapakah yang terbesar di antara mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side,
and said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui pikiran mereka. Karena itu Ia mengambil seorang anak kecil dan menempatkannya di samping-Nya,
dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.”

block.text: <<Barangsiapa menyambut anak ini dalam nama-Ku, ia menyambut Aku; dan barangsiapa menyambut Aku, ia menyambut Dia, yang mengutus Aku. Karena yang terkecil di antara kamu sekalian, dialah yang terbesar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered,

block.text: Yohanes berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn't follow with us.”

block.text: <<Guru, kami lihat seorang mengusir setan demi nama-Mu, lalu kami cegah orang itu, karena ia bukan pengikut kita.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.”

block.text: <<Jangan kamu cegah, sebab barangsiapa tidak melawan kamu, ia ada di pihak kamu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he resolutely set out for Jerusalem.

block.text: Ketika hampir genap waktunya Yesus diangkat ke sorga, Ia mengarahkan pandangan-Nya untuk pergi ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent messengers on ahead who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him.

block.text: Ia mengirim beberapa utusan mendahului Dia. Mereka itu pergi, lalu masuk ke suatu desa orang Samaria untuk mempersiapkan segala sesuatu bagi-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn't receive him because he was heading for Jerusalem.

block.text: Tetapi orang-orang Samaria itu tidak mau menerima Dia, karena perjalanan-Nya menuju Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said,

block.text: Ketika dua murid-Nya, yaitu Yakobus dan Yohanes, melihat hal itu, mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?”

block.text: <<Tuhan, apakah Engkau mau, supaya kami menyuruh api turun dari langit untuk membinasakan mereka?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he turned and rebuked them,

block.text: Tapi ia berbalik dan memarahi mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don't know of what kind of spirit you are.
For the Son of Man didn't come to destroy men's lives, but to save them.”

block.text: "Kau tidak tahu apa semangat Anda dari.
Sebab Anak Manusia datang bukan untuk menghancurkan kehidupan manusia, tetapi untuk menyelamatkan mereka."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went to another village.
As they went on the way, a certain man said to him,

block.text: Lalu mereka pergi ke desa yang lain.
Ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya melanjutkan perjalanan mereka, berkatalah seorang di tengah jalan kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.”

block.text: <<Aku akan mengikut Engkau, ke mana saja Engkau pergi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”

block.text: <<Serigala mempunyai liang dan burung mempunyai sarang, tetapi Anak Manusia tidak mempunyai tempat untuk meletakkan kepala-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to another,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada seorang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me!”

block.text: <<Ikutlah Aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Tetapi orang itu berkata:

block.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

block.text: <<Izinkanlah aku pergi dahulu menguburkan bapaku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: <<Biarlah orang mati menguburkan orang mati; tetapi engkau, pergilah dan beritakanlah Kerajaan Allah di mana-mana.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another also said,

block.text: Dan seorang lain lagi berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.”

block.text: <<Aku akan mengikut Engkau, Tuhan, tetapi izinkanlah aku pamitan dahulu dengan keluargaku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: <<Setiap orang yang siap untuk membajak tetapi menoleh ke belakang, tidak layak untuk Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 10
Now after these things, the Lord appointed seventy-two others, and said:

block.text: Kemudian dari pada itu Tuhan menunjuk tujuh puluh murid yang lain, lalu mengutus mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am sending you out two by two into every city and place where I am about to go.”

block.text: berdua-dua mendahului-Nya ke setiap kota dan tempat yang hendak dikunjungi-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.

block.text: <<Tuaian memang banyak, tetapi pekerja sedikit. Karena itu mintalah kepada Tuan yang empunya tuaian, supaya Ia mengirimkan pekerja-pekerja untuk tuaian itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.

block.text: Pergilah, sesungguhnya Aku mengutus kamu seperti anak domba ke tengah-tengah serigala.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor sandals. Greet no one on the way.

block.text: Janganlah membawa pundi-pundi atau bekal atau kasut, dan janganlah memberi salam kepada siapapun selama dalam perjalanan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’

block.text: Kalau kamu memasuki suatu rumah, katakanlah lebih dahulu: <Damai sejahtera bagi rumah ini.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.

block.text: Dan jikalau di situ ada orang yang layak menerima damai sejahtera, maka salammu itu akan tinggal atasnya. Tetapi jika tidak, salammu itu kembali kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Remain in that same house, eating and drinking the things they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Don't go from house to house.

block.text: Tinggallah dalam rumah itu, makan dan minumlah apa yang diberikan orang kepadamu, sebab seorang pekerja patut mendapat upahnya. Janganlah berpindah-pindah rumah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.

block.text: <<Dan jikalau kamu masuk ke dalam sebuah kota dan kamu diterima di situ, makanlah apa yang dihidangkan kepadamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heal the sick who are therein, and tell them, ‘The Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

block.text: Sembuhkanlah orang-orang sakit yang ada di situ dan katakanlah kepada mereka: <Kerajaan Allah sudah dekat padamu.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But into whatever city you enter, and they don't receive you, go out into its streets and say,

block.text: Tetapi jikalau kamu masuk ke dalam sebuah kota dan kamu tidak diterima di situ, pergilah ke jalan-jalan raya kota itu dan serukanlah:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that the Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

block.text: <Juga debu kotamu yang melekat pada kaki kami, kami kebaskan di depanmu; tetapi ketahuilah ini: Kerajaan Allah sudah dekat.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: pada hari itu Sodom akan lebih ringan tanggungannya dari pada kota itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

block.text: <<Celakalah engkau Khorazim! Celakalah engkau Betsaida! karena jika di Tirus dan di Sidon terjadi mujizat-mujizat yang telah terjadi di tengah-tengah kamu, sudah lama mereka bertobat dan berkabung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.

block.text: Akan tetapi pada waktu penghakiman, tanggungan Tirus dan Sidon akan lebih ringan dari pada tanggunganmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.

block.text: Dan engkau Kapernaum, apakah engkau akan dinaikkan sampai ke langit? Tidak, engkau akan diturunkan sampai ke dunia orang mati!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me. Whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.”

block.text: Barangsiapa mendengarkan kamu, ia mendengarkan Aku; dan barangsiapa menolak kamu, ia menolak Aku; dan barangsiapa menolak Aku, ia menolak Dia yang mengutus Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The seventy returned with joy, saying,

block.text: Kemudian ketujuh puluh murid itu kembali dengan gembira dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, juga setan-setan takluk kepada kami demi nama-Mu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.

block.text: <<Aku melihat Iblis jatuh seperti kilat dari langit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I give you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. Nothing will in any way hurt you.

block.text: Sesungguhnya Aku telah memberikan kuasa kepada kamu untuk menginjak ular dan kalajengking dan kuasa untuk menahan kekuatan musuh, sehingga tidak ada yang akan membahayakan kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless, don't rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”

block.text: Namun demikian janganlah bersukacita karena roh-roh itu takluk kepadamu, tetapi bersukacitalah karena namamu ada terdaftar di sorga.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that same hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said,

block.text: Pada waktu itu juga bergembiralah Yesus dalam Roh Kudus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.”

block.text: <<Aku bersyukur kepada-Mu, Bapa, Tuhan langit dan bumi, karena semuanya itu Engkau sembunyikan bagi orang bijak dan orang pandai, tetapi Engkau nyatakan kepada orang kecil. Ya Bapa, itulah yang berkenan kepada-Mu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.”

block.text: Semua telah diserahkan kepada-Ku oleh Bapa-Ku dan tidak ada seorangpun yang tahu siapakah Anak selain Bapa, dan siapakah Bapa selain Anak dan orang yang kepadanya Anak itu berkenan menyatakan hal itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Turning to the disciples, he said privately,

block.text: Sesudah itu berpalinglah Yesus kepada murid-murid-Nya tersendiri dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see,

block.text: <<Berbahagialah mata yang melihat apa yang kamu lihat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and didn't see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and didn't hear them.”

block.text: Karena Aku berkata kepada kamu: Banyak nabi dan raja ingin melihat apa yang kamu lihat, tetapi tidak melihatnya, dan ingin mendengar apa yang kamu dengar, tetapi tidak mendengarnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying,

block.text: Pada suatu kali berdirilah seorang ahli Taurat untuk mencobai Yesus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

block.text: <<Guru, apa yang harus kuperbuat untuk memperoleh hidup yang kekal?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”

block.text: <<Apa yang tertulis dalam hukum Taurat? Apa yang kaubaca di sana?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Jawab orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.”

block.text: <<Kasihilah Tuhan, Allahmu, dengan segenap hatimu dan dengan segenap jiwamu dan dengan segenap kekuatanmu dan dengan segenap akal budimu, dan kasihilah sesamamu manusia seperti dirimu sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”

block.text: <<Jawabmu itu benar; perbuatlah demikian, maka engkau akan hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus,

block.text: Tetapi untuk membenarkan dirinya orang itu berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is my neighbor?”

block.text: <<Dan siapakah sesamaku manusia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

block.text: <<Adalah seorang yang turun dari Yerusalem ke Yerikho; ia jatuh ke tangan penyamun-penyamun yang bukan saja merampoknya habis-habisan, tetapi yang juga memukulnya dan yang sesudah itu pergi meninggalkannya setengah mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

block.text: Kebetulan ada seorang imam turun melalui jalan itu; ia melihat orang itu, tetapi ia melewatinya dari seberang jalan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.

block.text: Demikian juga seorang Lewi datang ke tempat itu; ketika ia melihat orang itu, ia melewatinya dari seberang jalan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion.

block.text: <<Lalu datang seorang Samaria, yang sedang dalam perjalanan, ke tempat itu; dan ketika ia melihat orang itu, tergeraklah hatinya oleh belas kasihan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to him and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

block.text: Ia pergi kepadanya lalu membalut luka-lukanya, sesudah ia menyiraminya dengan minyak dan anggur. Kemudian ia menaikkan orang itu ke atas keledai tunggangannya sendiri lalu membawanya ke tempat penginapan dan merawatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, and gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’”

block.text: Keesokan harinya ia menyerahkan dua dinar kepada pemilik penginapan itu, katanya: <Rawatlah dia dan jika kaubelanjakan lebih dari ini, aku akan menggantinya, waktu aku kembali.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus asked him:

block.text: Jawab Yesus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?”

block.text: Siapakah di antara ketiga orang ini, menurut pendapatmu, adalah sesama manusia dari orang yang jatuh ke tangan penyamun itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who showed mercy on him.”

block.text: <<Orang yang telah menunjukkan belas kasihan kepadanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and do likewise.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, dan perbuatlah demikian!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

block.text: Ketika Yesus dan murid-murid-Nya dalam perjalanan, tibalah Ia di sebuah kampung. Seorang perempuan yang bernama Marta menerima Dia di rumahnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word.

block.text: Perempuan itu mempunyai seorang saudara yang bernama Maria. Maria ini duduk dekat kaki Tuhan dan terus mendengarkan perkataan-Nya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came up to him, and said,

block.text: sedang Marta sibuk sekali melayani. Ia mendekati Yesus dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don't you care that my sister left me to serve alone? Ask her therefore to help me.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, tidakkah Engkau peduli, bahwa saudaraku membiarkan aku melayani seorang diri? Suruhlah dia membantu aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered her,

block.text: Tetapi Tuhan menjawabnya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,
but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.”

block.text: <<Marta, Marta, engkau kuatir dan menyusahkan diri dengan banyak perkara,
tetapi hanya satu saja yang perlu: Maria telah memilih bagian yang terbaik, yang tidak akan diambil dari padanya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 11
It happened, that when he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him,

block.text: Pada suatu kali Yesus sedang berdoa di salah satu tempat. Ketika Ia berhenti berdoa, berkatalah seorang dari murid-murid-Nya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, ajarlah kami berdoa, sama seperti yang diajarkan Yohanes kepada murid-muridnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.

block.text: <<Apabila kamu berdoa, katakanlah: Bapa, dikuduskanlah nama-Mu; datanglah Kerajaan-Mu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.

block.text: Berikanlah kami setiap hari makanan kami yang secukupnya

ReferenceBlocks.text: Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.’”

block.text: dan ampunilah kami akan dosa kami, sebab kamipun mengampuni setiap orang yang bersalah kepada kami; dan janganlah membawa kami ke dalam pencobaan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread.

block.text: <<Jika seorang di antara kamu pada tengah malam pergi ke rumah seorang sahabatnya dan berkata kepadanya: <Saudara, pinjamkanlah kepadaku tiga roti,

ReferenceBlocks.text: A friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.’

block.text: sebab seorang sahabatku yang sedang berada dalam perjalanan singgah ke rumahku dan aku tidak mempunyai apa-apa untuk dihidangkan kepadanya;>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He from within will answer and say, ‘Don't bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can't get up and give it to you?’

block.text: masakan ia yang di dalam rumah itu akan menjawab: <Jangan mengganggu aku, pintu sudah tertutup dan aku serta anak-anakku sudah tidur; aku tidak dapat bangun dan memberikannya kepada saudara.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sekalipun ia tidak mau bangun dan memberikannya kepadanya karena orang itu adalah sahabatnya, namun karena sikapnya yang tidak malu itu, ia akan bangun juga dan memberikan kepadanya apa yang diperlukannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.

block.text: <<Oleh karena itu Aku berkata kepadamu: Mintalah, maka akan diberikan kepadamu; carilah, maka kamu akan mendapat; ketoklah, maka pintu akan dibukakan bagimu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.”

block.text: Karena setiap orang yang meminta, menerima dan setiap orang yang mencari, mendapat dan setiap orang yang mengetok, baginya pintu dibukakan.
