ReferenceBlocks.text: “The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

block.text: <<Akan datang waktunya kamu ingin melihat satu dari pada hari-hari Anak Manusia itu dan kamu tidak akan melihatnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will tell you, ‘Look, he is here!’ or ‘Look, he is there!’ Don't follow after them.

block.text: Dan orang akan berkata kepadamu: <Lihat, ia ada di sana;> <lihat, ia ada di sini!> Jangan kamu pergi ke situ, jangan kamu ikut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Son of Man comes, he will be like the flash of lighning that shines from one end of the sky to the other.

block.text: Sebab sama seperti kilat memancar dari ujung langit yang satu ke ujung langit yang lain, demikian pulalah kelak halnya Anak Manusia pada hari kedatangan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

block.text: Tetapi Ia harus menanggung banyak penderitaan dahulu dan ditolak oleh angkatan ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As it happened in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.

block.text: Dan sama seperti terjadi pada zaman Nuh, demikian pulalah halnya kelak pada hari-hari Anak Manusia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

block.text: mereka makan dan minum, mereka kawin dan dikawinkan, sampai kepada hari Nuh masuk ke dalam bahtera, lalu datanglah air bah dan membinasakan mereka semua.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise, even as it happened in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;

block.text: <<Demikian juga seperti yang terjadi di zaman Lot: mereka makan dan minum, mereka membeli dan menjual, mereka menanam dan membangun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky, and destroyed them all.

block.text: Tetapi pada hari Lot pergi keluar dari Sodom turunlah hujan api dan hujan belerang dari langit dan membinasakan mereka semua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.

block.text: Demikianlah halnya kelak pada hari, di mana Anak Manusia menyatakan diri-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that day, he who will be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.
Remember Lot's wife!

block.text: Barangsiapa pada hari itu sedang di peranginan di atas rumah dan barang-barangnya ada di dalam rumah, janganlah ia turun untuk mengambilnya, dan demikian juga orang yang sedang di ladang, janganlah ia kembali.
Ingatlah akan isteri Lot!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

block.text: Barangsiapa berusaha memelihara nyawanya, ia akan kehilangan nyawanya, dan barangsiapa kehilangan nyawanya, ia akan menyelamatkannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. The one will be taken, and the other will be left.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Pada malam itu ada dua orang di atas satu tempat tidur, yang seorang akan dibawa dan yang lain akan ditinggalkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.

block.text: Ada dua orang perempuan bersama-sama mengilang, yang seorang akan dibawa dan yang lain akan ditinggalkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Two men will be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.”

block.text: Kalau ada dua orang di ladang, yang seorang akan dibawa dan yang lain akan ditinggalkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, answering, asked him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where, Lord?”

block.text: <<Di mana, Tuhan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where the dead body is, there will the vultures also be gathered together.”

block.text: <<Di mana ada mayat, di situ berkerumun burung nasar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 18
He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up,
saying,

block.text: Yesus mengatakan suatu perumpamaan kepada mereka untuk menegaskan, bahwa mereka harus selalu berdoa dengan tidak jemu-jemu.
Kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There was a judge in a certain city who didn't fear God, and didn't respect man.

block.text: <<Dalam sebuah kota ada seorang hakim yang tidak takut akan Allah dan tidak menghormati seorangpun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’

block.text: Dan di kota itu ada seorang janda yang selalu datang kepada hakim itu dan berkata: <Belalah hakku terhadap lawanku.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wouldn't for a while, but afterward he said to himself, ‘It is true that I neither fear God, nor respect man.

block.text: Beberapa waktu lamanya hakim itu menolak. Tetapi kemudian ia berkata dalam hatinya: <Walaupun aku tidak takut akan Allah dan tidak menghormati seorangpun,

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, because this widow keeps bothering me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’”

block.text: namun karena janda ini menyusahkan aku, baiklah aku membenarkan dia, supaya jangan terus saja ia datang dan akhirnya menyerang aku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Kata Tuhan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.

block.text: <<Camkanlah apa yang dikatakan hakim yang lalim itu!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Won't God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?

block.text: Tidakkah Allah akan membenarkan orang-orang pilihan-Nya yang siang malam berseru kepada-Nya? Dan adakah Ia mengulur-ulur waktu sebelum menolong mereka?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Ia akan segera membenarkan mereka. Akan tetapi, jika Anak Manusia itu datang, adakah Ia mendapati iman di bumi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others.

block.text: Dan kepada beberapa orang yang menganggap dirinya benar dan memandang rendah semua orang lain, Yesus mengatakan perumpamaan ini:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.

block.text: <<Ada dua orang pergi ke Bait Allah untuk berdoa; yang seorang adalah Farisi dan yang lain pemungut cukai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortioners, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

block.text: Orang Farisi itu berdiri dan berdoa dalam hatinya begini: <Ya Allah, aku mengucap syukur kepada-Mu, karena aku tidak sama seperti semua orang lain, bukan perampok, bukan orang lalim, bukan pezinah dan bukan juga seperti pemungut cukai ini;

ReferenceBlocks.text: I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’

block.text: aku berpuasa dua kali seminggu, aku memberikan sepersepuluh dari segala penghasilanku.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn't even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’

block.text: Tetapi pemungut cukai itu berdiri jauh-jauh, bahkan ia tidak berani menengadah ke langit, melainkan ia memukul diri dan berkata: <Ya Allah, kasihanilah aku orang berdosa ini.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Orang ini pulang ke rumahnya sebagai orang yang dibenarkan Allah dan orang lain itu tidak. Sebab barangsiapa meninggikan diri, ia akan direndahkan dan barangsiapa merendahkan diri, ia akan ditinggikan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they said:

block.text: Maka datanglah orang-orang membawa anak-anaknya yang kecil kepada Yesus, supaya Ia menjamah mereka. Melihat itu murid-murid-Nya

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not bother the teacher!”

block.text: memarahi orang-orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned them, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus memanggil mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children to come to me, and don't hinder them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

block.text: <<Biarkanlah anak-anak itu datang kepada-Ku, dan jangan kamu menghalang-halangi mereka, sebab orang-orang yang seperti itulah yang empunya Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn't receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya barangsiapa tidak menyambut Kerajaan Allah seperti seorang anak kecil, ia tidak akan masuk ke dalamnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain ruler asked him, saying,

block.text: Ada seorang pemimpin bertanya kepada Yesus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

block.text: <<Guru yang baik, apa yang harus aku perbuat untuk memperoleh hidup yang kekal?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus asked him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one--God.

block.text: <<Mengapa kaukatakan Aku baik? Tak seorangpun yang baik selain dari pada Allah saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know the commandments: ‘Don't commit adultery,’ ‘Don't murder,’ ‘Don't steal,’ ‘Don't give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”

block.text: Engkau tentu mengetahui segala perintah Allah: <Jangan berzinah, jangan membunuh, jangan mencuri, jangan mengucapkan saksi dusta, hormatilah ayahmu dan ibumu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Kata orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have observed all these things from my youth up.”

block.text: <<Semuanya itu telah kuturuti sejak masa mudaku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him,

block.text: Mendengar itu Yesus berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.”

block.text: <<Masih tinggal satu hal lagi yang harus kaulakukan: juallah segala yang kaumiliki dan bagi-bagikanlah itu kepada orang-orang miskin, maka engkau akan beroleh harta di sorga, kemudian datanglah ke mari dan ikutlah Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.
Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said,

block.text: Ketika orang itu mendengar perkataan itu, ia menjadi amat sedih, sebab ia sangat kaya.
Lalu Yesus memandang dia dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: <<Alangkah sukarnya orang yang beruang masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Sebab lebih mudah seekor unta masuk melalui lobang jarum dari pada seorang kaya masuk ke dalam Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who heard it said,

block.text: Dan mereka yang mendengar itu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then who can be saved?”

block.text: <<Jika demikian, siapakah yang dapat diselamatkan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Kata Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

block.text: <<Apa yang tidak mungkin bagi manusia, mungkin bagi Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said,

block.text: Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look, we have left everything, and followed you.”

block.text: <<Kami ini telah meninggalkan segala kepunyaan kami dan mengikut Engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for the Kingdom of God's sake,
who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya setiap orang yang karena Kerajaan Allah meninggalkan rumahnya, isterinya atau saudaranya, orang tuanya atau anak-anaknya,
akan menerima kembali lipat ganda pada masa ini juga, dan pada zaman yang akan datang ia akan menerima hidup yang kekal.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the twelve aside, and said to them,

block.text: Yesus memanggil kedua belas murid-Nya, lalu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.

block.text: <<Sekarang kita pergi ke Yerusalem dan segala sesuatu yang ditulis oleh para nabi mengenai Anak Manusia akan digenapi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.

block.text: Sebab Ia akan diserahkan kepada bangsa-bangsa yang tidak mengenal Allah, diolok-olokkan, dihina dan diludahi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”

block.text: dan mereka menyesah dan membunuh Dia, dan pada hari ketiga Ia akan bangkit.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn't understand the things that were said.

block.text: Akan tetapi mereka sama sekali tidak mengerti semuanya itu; arti perkataan itu tersembunyi bagi mereka dan mereka tidak tahu apa yang dimaksudkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.

block.text: Waktu Yesus hampir tiba di Yerikho, ada seorang buta yang duduk di pinggir jalan dan mengemis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked:

block.text: Waktu orang itu mendengar orang banyak lewat, ia bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is going on?”

block.text: <<Apa itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him:

block.text: Kata orang kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”

block.text: <<Yesus orang Nazaret lewat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He cried out,

block.text: Lalu ia berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Yesus, Anak Daud, kasihanilah aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who led the way rebuked him and said:

block.text: Maka mereka, yang berjalan di depan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: menegor dia supaya ia diam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he cried out all the more,

block.text: Namun semakin keras ia berseru:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Anak Daud, kasihanilah aku!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berhenti dan menyuruh membawa orang itu kepada-Nya. Dan ketika ia telah berada di dekat-Nya, Yesus bertanya kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do?”

block.text: <<Apa yang kaukehendaki supaya Aku perbuat bagimu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab orang itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, that I may see again.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, supaya aku dapat melihat!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”

block.text: <<Melihatlah engkau, imanmu telah menyelamatkan engkau!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he received his sight and followed him, glorifying God, saying:

block.text: Dan seketika itu juga melihatlah ia, lalu mengikuti Dia sambil

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”

block.text: memuliakan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people, when they saw it, praised God.

block.text: Seluruh rakyat melihat hal itu dan memuji-muji Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 19
He entered and was passing through Jericho.

block.text: Yesus masuk ke kota Yerikho dan berjalan terus melintasi kota itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

block.text: Di situ ada seorang bernama Zakheus, kepala pemungut cukai, dan ia seorang yang kaya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn't because of the crowd, because he was short.

block.text: Ia berusaha untuk melihat orang apakah Yesus itu, tetapi ia tidak berhasil karena orang banyak, sebab badannya pendek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was to pass that way.

block.text: Maka berlarilah ia mendahului orang banyak, lalu memanjat pohon ara untuk melihat Yesus, yang akan lewat di situ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him,

block.text: Ketika Yesus sampai ke tempat itu, Ia melihat ke atas dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”

block.text: <<Zakheus, segeralah turun, sebab hari ini Aku harus menumpang di rumahmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully.

block.text: Lalu Zakheus segera turun dan menerima Yesus dengan sukacita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying,

block.text: Tetapi semua orang yang melihat hal itu bersungut-sungut, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.”

block.text: <<Ia menumpang di rumah orang berdosa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord,

block.text: Tetapi Zakheus berdiri dan berkata kepada Tuhan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, setengah dari milikku akan kuberikan kepada orang miskin dan sekiranya ada sesuatu yang kuperas dari seseorang akan kukembalikan empat kali lipat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

block.text: <<Hari ini telah terjadi keselamatan kepada rumah ini, karena orang inipun anak Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”

block.text: Sebab Anak Manusia datang untuk mencari dan menyelamatkan yang hilang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that the Kingdom of God would be revealed immediately.
He said therefore,

block.text: Untuk mereka yang mendengarkan Dia di situ, Yesus melanjutkan perkataan-Nya dengan suatu perumpamaan, sebab Ia sudah dekat Yerusalem dan mereka menyangka, bahwa Kerajaan Allah akan segera kelihatan.
Maka Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

block.text: <<Ada seorang bangsawan berangkat ke sebuah negeri yang jauh untuk dinobatkan menjadi raja di situ dan setelah itu baru kembali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called ten servants of his, and gave them ten mina coins, and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’

block.text: Ia memanggil sepuluh orang hambanya dan memberikan sepuluh mina kepada mereka, katanya: <Pakailah ini untuk berdagang sampai aku datang kembali.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don't want this man to reign over us.’”

block.text: Akan tetapi orang-orang sebangsanya membenci dia, lalu mengirimkan utusan menyusul dia untuk mengatakan: <Kami tidak mau orang ini menjadi raja atas kami.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It happened when he had come back again, having received the kingdom, that he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.

block.text: Dan terjadilah, ketika ia kembali, setelah ia dinobatkan menjadi raja, ia menyuruh memanggil hamba-hambanya, yang telah diberinya uang itu, untuk mengetahui berapa hasil dagang mereka masing-masing.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’”

block.text: Orang yang pertama datang dan berkata: Tuan, mina tuan yang satu itu telah menghasilkan sepuluh mina.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’”

block.text: Katanya kepada orang itu: Baik sekali perbuatanmu itu, hai hamba yang baik; engkau telah setia dalam perkara kecil, karena itu terimalah kekuasaan atas sepuluh kota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’”

block.text: Datanglah yang kedua dan berkata: Tuan, mina tuan telah menghasilkan lima mina.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’

block.text: Katanya kepada orang itu: Dan engkau, kuasailah lima kota.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief

block.text: Dan hamba yang ketiga datang dan berkata: Tuan, inilah mina tuan, aku telah menyimpannya dalam sapu tangan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I was afraid of you because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn't lay down, and reap that which you didn't sow.’”

block.text: Sebab aku takut akan tuan, karena tuan adalah manusia yang keras; tuan mengambil apa yang tidak pernah tuan taruh dan tuan menuai apa yang tidak tuan tabur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn't lay down, and reaping that which I didn't sow.

block.text: <<Katanya kepada orang itu: <Hai hamba yang jahat, aku akan menghakimi engkau menurut perkataanmu sendiri. Engkau sudah tahu bahwa aku adalah orang yang keras, yang mengambil apa yang tidak pernah aku taruh dan menuai apa yang tidak aku tabur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then why didn't you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’

block.text: Jika demikian, mengapa uangku itu tidak kauberikan kepada orang yang menjalankan uang? Maka sekembaliku aku dapat mengambilnya serta dengan bunganya.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to him who has the ten minas.’”

block.text: Lalu katanya kepada orang-orang yang berdiri di situ: <Ambillah mina yang satu itu dari padanya dan berikanlah kepada orang yang mempunyai sepuluh mina itu.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’

block.text: <<Kata mereka kepadanya: <Tuan, ia sudah mempunyai sepuluh mina.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He replied to them, ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn't have, even that which he has will be taken away.

block.text: Jawabnya: <Aku berkata kepadamu: Setiap orang yang mempunyai, kepadanya akan diberi, tetapi siapa yang tidak mempunyai, dari padanya akan diambil, juga apa yang ada padanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But bring those enemies of mine who didn't want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’”

block.text: Akan tetapi semua seteruku ini, yang tidak suka aku menjadi rajanya, bawalah mereka ke mari dan bunuhlah mereka di depan mataku.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Dan setelah mengatakan semuanya itu Yesus mendahului mereka dan meneruskan perjalanan-Nya ke Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when he drew near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,
saying,

block.text: Ketika Ia telah dekat Betfage dan Betania, yang terletak di gunung yang bernama Bukit Zaitun, Yesus menyuruh dua orang murid-Nya
dengan pesan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat. Untie it, and bring it.

block.text: <<Pergilah ke kampung yang di depanmu itu: Pada waktu kamu masuk di situ, kamu akan mendapati seekor keledai muda tertambat, yang belum pernah ditunggangi orang. Lepaskanlah keledai itu dan bawalah ke mari.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’”

block.text: Dan jika ada orang bertanya kepadamu: <Mengapa kamu melepaskannya?> jawablah begini: <Tuhan memerlukannya.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them.

block.text: Lalu pergilah mereka yang disuruh itu, dan mereka mendapati segala sesuatu seperti yang telah dikatakan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them,

block.text: Ketika mereka melepaskan keledai itu, berkatalah orang yang empunya keledai itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you untying the colt?”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu melepaskan keledai itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord needs it.”

block.text: <<Tuhan memerlukannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.

block.text: Mereka membawa keledai itu kepada Yesus, lalu mengalasinya dengan pakaian mereka dan menolong Yesus naik ke atasnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he went, they spread their cloaks in the way.

block.text: Dan sementara Yesus mengendarai keledai itu mereka menghamparkan pakaiannya di jalan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,
saying,

block.text: Ketika Ia dekat Yerusalem, di tempat jalan menurun dari Bukit Zaitun, mulailah semua murid yang mengiringi Dia bergembira dan memuji Allah dengan suara nyaring oleh karena segala mujizat yang telah mereka lihat.
Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”

block.text: <<Diberkatilah Dia yang datang sebagai Raja dalam nama Tuhan, damai sejahtera di sorga dan kemuliaan di tempat yang mahatinggi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him,

block.text: Beberapa orang Farisi yang turut dengan orang banyak itu berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

block.text: <<Guru, tegorlah murid-murid-Mu itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu: Jika mereka ini diam, maka batu ini akan berteriak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he drew near, he saw the city and wept over it,
saying,

block.text: Dan ketika Yesus telah dekat dan melihat kota itu, Ia menangisinya,
kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.

block.text: <<Wahai, betapa baiknya jika pada hari ini juga engkau mengerti apa yang perlu untuk damai sejahteramu! Tetapi sekarang hal itu tersembunyi bagi matamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the days will come on you, when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side.

block.text: Sebab akan datang harinya, bahwa musuhmu akan mengelilingi engkau dengan kubu, lalu mengepung engkau dan menghimpit engkau dari segala jurusan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn't know the time of your visitation.”

block.text: dan mereka akan membinasakan engkau beserta dengan pendudukmu dan pada tembokmu mereka tidak akan membiarkan satu batupun tinggal terletak di atas batu yang lain, karena engkau tidak mengetahui saat, bilamana Allah melawat engkau.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the temple, and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,
saying to them,

block.text: Lalu Yesus masuk ke Bait Allah dan mulailah Ia mengusir semua pedagang di situ,
kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”

block.text: <<Ada tertulis: <Rumah-Ku adalah rumah doa.> Tetapi kamu menjadikannya <sarang penyamun.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.

block.text: Tiap-tiap hari Ia mengajar di dalam Bait Allah. Imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat serta orang-orang terkemuka dari bangsa Israel berusaha untuk membinasakan Dia,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They couldn't find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.

block.text: tetapi mereka tidak tahu, bagaimana harus melakukannya, sebab seluruh rakyat terpikat kepada-Nya dan ingin mendengarkan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 20
It happened on one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, that the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.
They asked him,

block.text: Pada suatu hari ketika Yesus mengajar orang banyak di Bait Allah dan memberitakan Injil, datanglah imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat serta tua-tua ke situ,
dan mereka berkata kepada Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”

block.text: <<Katakanlah kepada kami dengan kuasa manakah Engkau melakukan hal-hal itu, dan siapa yang memberikan kuasa itu kepada-Mu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:
the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”

block.text: <<Aku juga akan mengajukan suatu pertanyaan kepada kamu. Katakanlah kepada-Ku:
Baptisan Yohanes itu, dari sorga atau dari manusia?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Mereka mempertimbangkannya di antara mereka, dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn't you believe him?’

block.text: <<Jikalau kita katakan: <Dari sorga,> Ia akan berkata: <Mengapakah kamu tidak percaya kepadanya?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”

block.text: Tetapi jikalau kita katakan: <Dari manusia,> seluruh rakyat akan melempari kita dengan batu, sebab mereka yakin, bahwa Yohanes adalah seorang nabi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered, saying:

block.text: Lalu mereka menjawab,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don't know.”

block.text: bahwa mereka tidak tahu dari mana baptisan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Maka kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

block.text: <<Jika demikian, Aku juga tidak mengatakan kepadamu dengan kuasa manakah Aku melakukan hal-hal itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began to tell the people this parable.

block.text: Lalu Yesus mengatakan perumpamaan ini kepada orang banyak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.

block.text: <<Seorang membuka kebun anggur; kemudian ia menyewakannya kepada penggarap-penggarap lalu berangkat ke negeri lain untuk waktu yang agak lama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Dan ketika sudah tiba musimnya, ia menyuruh seorang hamba kepada penggarap-penggarap itu, supaya mereka menyerahkan sebagian dari hasil kebun anggur itu kepadanya. Tetapi penggarap-penggarap itu memukul hamba itu dan menyuruhnya pulang dengan tangan hampa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Sesudah itu ia menyuruh seorang hamba yang lain, tetapi hamba itu juga dipukul dan dipermalukan oleh mereka, lalu disuruh pulang dengan tangan hampa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.

block.text: Selanjutnya ia menyuruh hamba yang ketiga, tetapi orang itu juga dilukai oleh mereka, lalu dilemparkan ke luar kebun itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’”

block.text: <<Maka kata tuan kebun anggur itu: <Apakah yang harus kuperbuat? Aku akan menyuruh anakku yang kekasih; tentu ia mereka segani.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’

block.text: Tetapi ketika penggarap-penggarap itu melihat anaknya itu, mereka berunding, katanya: <Ia adalah ahli waris, mari kita bunuh dia, supaya warisan ini menjadi milik kita.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?

block.text: Lalu mereka melemparkan dia ke luar kebun anggur itu dan membunuhnya. Sekarang apa yang akan dilakukan oleh tuan kebun anggur itu dengan mereka?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.”

block.text: Ia akan datang dan membinasakan penggarap-penggarap itu, dan mempercayakan kebun anggur itu kepada orang-orang lain.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they said,

block.text: Mendengar itu mereka berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May it never be!”

block.text: <<Sekali-kali jangan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he looked at them, and said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus memandang mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the chief cornerstone?’

block.text: <<Jika demikian apakah arti nas ini: <Batu yang dibuang oleh tukang-tukang bangunan telah menjadi batu penjuru?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”

block.text: Barangsiapa jatuh ke atas batu itu, ia akan hancur, dan barangsiapa ditimpa batu itu, ia akan remuk.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people--for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.

block.text: Lalu ahli-ahli Taurat dan imam-imam kepala berusaha menangkap Dia pada saat itu juga, sebab mereka tahu, bahwa merekalah yang dimaksudkan Nya dengan perumpamaan itu, tetapi mereka takut kepada orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
They asked him,

block.text: Ahli-ahli Taurat dan imam-imam kepala mengamat-amati Yesus. Mereka menyuruh kepada-Nya mata-mata yang berlaku seolah-olah orang jujur, supaya mereka dapat menjerat-Nya dengan suatu pertanyaan dan menyerahkan-Nya kepada wewenang dan kuasa wali negeri.
Orang-orang itu mengajukan pertanyaan ini kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren't partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.

block.text: <<Guru, kami tahu, bahwa segala perkataan dan pengajaran-Mu benar dan Engkau tidak mencari muka, melainkan dengan jujur mengajar jalan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

block.text: Apakah kami diperbolehkan membayar pajak kepada Kaisar atau tidak?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus mengetahui maksud mereka yang licik itu, lalu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me?
Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”

block.text: <<Tunjukkanlah kepada-Ku suatu dinar; gambar dan tulisan siapakah ada padanya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar's.”

block.text: <<Gambar dan tulisan Kaisar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu kata Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”

block.text: <<Kalau begitu berikanlah kepada Kaisar apa yang wajib kamu berikan kepada Kaisar dan kepada Allah apa yang wajib kamu berikan kepada Allah!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They weren't able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer, and were silent.

block.text: Dan mereka tidak dapat menjerat Dia dalam perkataan-Nya di depan orang banyak. Mereka heran akan jawab-Nya itu dan mereka diam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection. They asked him,

block.text: Maka datanglah kepada Yesus beberapa orang Saduki, yang tidak mengakui adanya kebangkitan. Mereka bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man's brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up children for his brother.

block.text: <<Guru, Musa menuliskan perintah ini untuk kita: Jika seorang, yang mempunyai saudara laki-laki, mati sedang isterinya masih ada, tetapi ia tidak meninggalkan anak, saudaranya harus kawin dengan isterinya itu dan membangkitkan keturunan bagi saudaranya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.

block.text: Adalah tujuh orang bersaudara. Yang pertama kawin dengan seorang perempuan lalu mati dengan tidak meninggalkan anak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

block.text: Lalu perempuan itu dikawini oleh yang kedua,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.

block.text: dan oleh yang ketiga dan demikianlah berturut-turut oleh ketujuh saudara itu, mereka semuanya mati dengan tidak meninggalkan anak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward the woman also died.

block.text: Akhirnya perempuan itupun mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”

block.text: Bagaimana sekarang dengan perempuan itu, siapakah di antara orang-orang itu yang menjadi suaminya pada hari kebangkitan? Sebab ketujuhnya telah beristerikan dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.

block.text: <<Orang-orang dunia ini kawin dan dikawinkan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage.

block.text: tetapi mereka yang dianggap layak untuk mendapat bagian dalam dunia yang lain itu dan dalam kebangkitan dari antara orang mati, tidak kawin dan tidak dikawinkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they can't die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.

block.text: Sebab mereka tidak dapat mati lagi; mereka sama seperti malaikat-malaikat dan mereka adalah anak-anak Allah, karena mereka telah dibangkitkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

block.text: Tentang bangkitnya orang-orang mati, Musa telah memberitahukannya dalam nas tentang semak duri, di mana Tuhan disebut <Allah Abraham, Allah Ishak dan Allah Yakub.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”

block.text: Ia bukan Allah orang mati, melainkan Allah orang hidup, sebab di hadapan Dia semua orang hidup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the scribes answered,

block.text: Mendengar itu beberapa ahli Taurat berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, you speak well.”

block.text: <<Guru, jawab-Mu itu tepat sekali.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn't dare to ask him any more questions.
He said to them,

block.text: Sebab mereka tidak berani lagi menanyakan apa-apa kepada Yesus.
Tetapi Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do they say that the Christ is David's son?

block.text: <<Bagaimana orang dapat mengatakan, bahwa Mesias adalah Anak Daud?

ReferenceBlocks.text: David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,
until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.’”

block.text: Sebab Daud sendiri berkata dalam kitab Mazmur: <Tuhan telah berfirman kepada Tuanku: <<duduklah di sebelah kanan-Ku,
sampai Kubuat musuh-musuh-Mu menjadi tumpuan kaki-Mu.>> >

ReferenceBlocks.text: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”

block.text: Jadi Daud menyebut Dia Tuannya, bagaimana mungkin Ia anaknya pula?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Ketika semua orang banyak mendengarkan, Yesus berkata kepada murid-murid-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts.

block.text: <<Waspadalah terhadap ahli-ahli Taurat yang suka berjalan-jalan memakai jubah panjang dan suka menerima penghormatan di pasar, yang suka duduk di tempat terdepan di rumah ibadat dan di tempat terhormat dalam perjamuan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”

block.text: yang menelan rumah janda-janda dan yang mengelabui mata orang dengan doa yang panjang-panjang. Mereka itu pasti akan menerima hukuman yang lebih berat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 21
He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.

block.text: Ketika Yesus mengangkat muka-Nya, Ia melihat orang-orang kaya memasukkan persembahan mereka ke dalam peti persembahan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.
He said,

block.text: Ia melihat juga seorang janda miskin memasukkan dua peser ke dalam peti itu.
Lalu Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them.

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya janda miskin ini memberi lebih banyak dari pada semua orang itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”

block.text: Sebab mereka semua memberi persembahannya dari kelimpahannya, tetapi janda ini memberi dari kekurangannya, bahkan ia memberi seluruh nafkahnya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some were talking about the temple, saying:

block.text: Ketika beberapa orang

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look at the precious stones and offerings to God that adorn the temple!”

block.text: berbicara tentang Bait Allah dan mengagumi bangunan itu yang dihiasi dengan batu yang indah-indah dan dengan berbagai-bagai barang persembahan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said:

block.text: berkatalah Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”

block.text: <<Apa yang kamu lihat di situ—akan datang harinya di mana tidak ada satu batupun akan dibiarkan terletak di atas batu yang lain; semuanya akan diruntuhkan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Dan murid-murid bertanya kepada Yesus, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”

block.text: <<Guru, bilamanakah itu akan terjadi? Dan apakah tandanya, kalau itu akan terjadi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Watch out that you don't get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am Christ,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don't follow them.

block.text: <<Waspadalah, supaya kamu jangan disesatkan. Sebab banyak orang akan datang dengan memakai nama-Ku dan berkata: <Akulah Dia,> dan: <Saatnya sudah dekat.> Janganlah kamu mengikuti mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don't be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won't come immediately.”

block.text: Dan apabila kamu mendengar tentang peperangan dan pemberontakan, janganlah kamu terkejut. Sebab semuanya itu harus terjadi dahulu, tetapi itu tidak berarti kesudahannya akan datang segera.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

block.text: <<Bangsa akan bangkit melawan bangsa dan kerajaan melawan kerajaan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.

block.text: dan akan terjadi gempa bumi yang dahsyat dan di berbagai tempat akan ada penyakit sampar dan kelaparan, dan akan terjadi juga hal-hal yang mengejutkan dan tanda-tanda yang dahsyat dari langit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name's sake.

block.text: Tetapi sebelum semuanya itu kamu akan ditangkap dan dianiaya; kamu akan diserahkan ke rumah-rumah ibadat dan penjara-penjara, dan kamu akan dihadapkan kepada raja-raja dan penguasa-penguasa oleh karena nama-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This will result in you being witnesses to them.

block.text: Hal itu akan menjadi kesempatan bagimu untuk bersaksi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer.

block.text: << Sebab itu tetapkanlah di dalam hatimu, supaya kamu jangan memikirkan lebih dahulu pembelaanmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.

block.text: Sebab Aku sendiri akan memberikan kepadamu kata-kata hikmat, sehingga kamu tidak dapat ditentang atau dibantah lawan-lawanmu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.

block.text: Dan kamu akan diserahkan juga oleh orang tuamu, saudara-saudaramu, kaum keluargamu dan sahabat-sahabatmu dan beberapa orang di antara kamu akan dibunuh

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake.

block.text: dan kamu akan dibenci semua orang oleh karena nama-Ku.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And not a hair of your head will perish.”
“By your endurance you will win your lives.”

block.text: Tetapi tidak sehelaipun dari rambut kepalamu akan hilang.
Kalau kamu tetap bertahan, kamu akan memperoleh hidupmu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.

block.text: <<Apabila kamu melihat Yerusalem dikepung oleh tentara-tentara, ketahuilah, bahwa keruntuhannya sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the midst of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.

block.text: Pada waktu itu orang-orang yang berada di Yudea harus melarikan diri ke pegunungan, dan orang-orang yang berada di dalam kota harus mengungsi, dan orang-orang yang berada di pedusunan jangan masuk lagi ke dalam kota,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

block.text: sebab itulah masa pembalasan di mana akan genap semua yang ada tertulis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.

block.text: Celakalah ibu-ibu yang sedang hamil atau yang menyusukan bayi pada masa itu! Sebab akan datang kesesakan yang dahsyat atas seluruh negeri dan murka atas bangsa ini,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

block.text: dan mereka akan tewas oleh mata pedang dan dibawa sebagai tawanan ke segala bangsa, dan Yerusalem akan diinjak-injak oleh bangsa-bangsa yang tidak mengenal Allah, sampai genaplah zaman bangsa-bangsa itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves.

block.text: <<Dan akan ada tanda-tanda pada matahari dan bulan dan bintang-bintang, dan di bumi bangsa-bangsa akan takut dan bingung menghadapi deru dan gelora laut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Men will faint for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: Orang akan mati ketakutan karena kecemasan berhubung dengan segala apa yang menimpa bumi ini, sebab kuasa-kuasa langit akan goncang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

block.text: Pada waktu itu orang akan melihat Anak Manusia datang dalam awan dengan segala kekuasaan dan kemuliaan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”

block.text: Apabila semuanya itu mulai terjadi, bangkitlah dan angkatlah mukamu, sebab penyelamatanmu sudah dekat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told them a parable.

block.text: Lalu Yesus mengatakan perumpamaan ini kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See the fig tree, and all the trees.

block.text: <<Perhatikanlah pohon ara atau pohon apa saja.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.

block.text: Apabila kamu melihat pohon-pohon itu sudah bertunas, kamu tahu dengan sendirinya bahwa musim panas sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that the Kingdom of God is near.

block.text: Demikian juga, jika kamu melihat hal-hal itu terjadi, ketahuilah, bahwa Kerajaan Allah sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.

block.text: Aku berkata kepadamu: Sesungguhnya angkatan ini tidak akan berlalu, sebelum semuanya terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.”

block.text: Langit dan bumi akan berlalu, tetapi perkataan-Ku tidak akan berlalu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.

block.text: <<Jagalah dirimu, supaya hatimu jangan sarat oleh pesta pora dan kemabukan serta kepentingan-kepentingan duniawi dan supaya hari Tuhan jangan dengan tiba-tiba jatuh ke atas dirimu seperti suatu jerat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.

block.text: Sebab ia akan menimpa semua penduduk bumi ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”

block.text: Berjaga-jagalah senantiasa sambil berdoa, supaya kamu beroleh kekuatan untuk luput dari semua yang akan terjadi itu, dan supaya kamu tahan berdiri di hadapan Anak Manusia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.

block.text: Pada siang hari Yesus mengajar di Bait Allah dan pada malam hari Ia keluar dan bermalam di gunung yang bernama Bukit Zaitun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.

block.text: Dan pagi-pagi semua orang banyak datang kepada-Nya di dalam Bait Allah untuk mendengarkan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 22
Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, drew near.

block.text: Hari raya Roti Tidak Beragi, yang disebut Paskah, sudah dekat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people.

block.text: Imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat mencari jalan, bagaimana mereka dapat membunuh Yesus, sebab mereka takut kepada orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Satan entered into Judas, who was surnamed Iscariot, who was numbered with the twelve.

block.text: Maka masuklah Iblis ke dalam Yudas, yang bernama Iskariot, seorang dari kedua belas murid itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went to talk with the chief priests and captains, saying:

block.text: Lalu pergilah Yudas kepada imam-imam kepala dan kepala-kepala pengawal Bait Allah dan berunding dengan mereka, bagaimana ia dapat

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will deliver him to you.”

block.text: menyerahkan Yesus kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were glad, and said:

block.text: Mereka sangat gembira dan bermupakat untuk memberikan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We will pay you for this.”

block.text: sejumlah uang kepadanya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He consented, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude.

block.text: Ia menyetujuinya, dan mulai dari waktu itu ia mencari kesempatan yang baik untuk menyerahkan Yesus kepada mereka tanpa setahu orang banyak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.

block.text: Maka tibalah hari raya Roti Tidak Beragi, yaitu hari di mana orang harus menyembelih domba Paskah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent Peter and John, saying,

block.text: Lalu Yesus menyuruh Petrus dan Yohanes, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”

block.text: <<Pergilah, persiapkanlah perjamuan Paskah bagi kita supaya kita makan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Kata mereka kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where do you want us to prepare?”

block.text: <<Di manakah Engkau kehendaki kami mempersiapkannya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.

block.text: <<Apabila kamu masuk ke dalam kota, kamu akan bertemu dengan seorang yang membawa kendi berisi air. Ikutilah dia ke dalam rumah yang dimasukinya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

block.text: dan katakanlah kepada tuan rumah itu: <Guru bertanya kepadamu: di manakah ruangan tempat Aku bersama-sama dengan murid-murid-Ku akan makan Paskah?>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”

block.text: Lalu orang itu akan menunjukkan kepadamu sebuah ruangan atas yang besar yang sudah lengkap, di situlah kamu harus mempersiapkannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went, found things as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

block.text: Maka berangkatlah mereka dan mereka mendapati semua seperti yang dikatakan Yesus kepada mereka. Lalu mereka mempersiapkan Paskah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles.
He said to them,

block.text: Ketika tiba saatnya, Yesus duduk makan bersama-sama dengan rasul-rasul-Nya.
Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

block.text: <<Aku sangat rindu makan Paskah ini bersama-sama dengan kamu, sebelum Aku menderita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Sebab Aku berkata kepadamu: Aku tidak akan memakannya lagi sampai ia beroleh kegenapannya dalam Kerajaan Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said,

block.text: Kemudian Ia mengambil sebuah cawan, mengucap syukur, lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take this, and share it among yourselves.

block.text: <<Ambillah ini dan bagikanlah di antara kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until the Kingdom of God comes.”

block.text: Sebab Aku berkata kepada kamu: mulai dari sekarang ini Aku tidak akan minum lagi hasil pokok anggur sampai Kerajaan Allah telah datang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it, and gave to them, saying,

block.text: Lalu Ia mengambil roti, mengucap syukur, memecah-mecahkannya dan memberikannya kepada mereka, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”

block.text: <<Inilah tubuh-Ku yang diserahkan bagi kamu; perbuatlah ini menjadi peringatan akan Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying,

block.text: Demikian juga dibuat-Nya dengan cawan sesudah makan; Ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

block.text: <<Cawan ini adalah perjanjian baru oleh darah-Ku, yang ditumpahkan bagi kamu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.

block.text: Tetapi, lihat, tangan orang yang menyerahkan Aku, ada bersama dengan Aku di meja ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man indeed goes, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”

block.text: Sebab Anak Manusia memang akan pergi seperti yang telah ditetapkan, akan tetapi, celakalah orang yang olehnya Ia diserahkan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to question among themselves, saying:

block.text: Lalu mulailah mereka mempersoalkan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who among us would do such a terrible thing?”

block.text: siapa di antara mereka yang akan berbuat demikian.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There also arose a contention among them. They argued, saying:

block.text: Terjadilah juga pertengkaran di antara murid-murid Yesus,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which one of us is the greatest?”

block.text: siapakah yang dapat dianggap terbesar di antara mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’

block.text: <<Raja-raja bangsa-bangsa memerintah rakyat mereka dan orang-orang yang menjalankan kuasa atas mereka disebut pelindung-pelindung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But not so with you. But one who is the greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.

block.text: Tetapi kamu tidaklah demikian, melainkan yang terbesar di antara kamu hendaklah menjadi sebagai yang paling muda dan pemimpin sebagai pelayan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn't it he who sits at the table? But I am in the midst of you as one who serves.

block.text: Sebab siapakah yang lebih besar: yang duduk makan, atau yang melayani? Bukankah dia yang duduk makan? Tetapi Aku ada di tengah-tengah kamu sebagai pelayan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.

block.text: Kamulah yang tetap tinggal bersama-sama dengan Aku dalam segala pencobaan yang Aku alami.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me.

block.text: Dan Aku menentukan hak-hak Kerajaan bagi kamu, sama seperti Bapa-Ku menentukannya bagi-Ku,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”

block.text: bahwa kamu akan makan dan minum semeja dengan Aku di dalam Kerajaan-Ku dan kamu akan duduk di atas takhta untuk menghakimi kedua belas suku Israel.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Jawab

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have you, that he might sift you as wheat,

block.text: << Simon, Simon, lihat, Iblis telah menuntut untuk menampi kamu seperti gandum,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn't fail. You, when once you have turned again, must help to strengthen your brothers.”

block.text: tetapi Aku telah berdoa untuk engkau, supaya imanmu jangan gugur. Dan engkau, jikalau engkau sudah insaf, kuatkanlah saudara-saudaramu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jawab Petrus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”

block.text: <<Tuhan, aku bersedia masuk penjara dan mati bersama-sama dengan Engkau!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, Petrus, hari ini ayam tidak akan berkokok, sebelum engkau tiga kali menyangkal, bahwa engkau mengenal Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When I sent you out without purse, and wallet, and shoes, did you lack anything?”

block.text: <<Ketika Aku mengutus kamu dengan tiada membawa pundi-pundi, bekal dan kasut, adakah kamu kekurangan apa-apa?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nothing.”

block.text: <<Suatupun tidak.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.

block.text: <<Tetapi sekarang ini, siapa yang mempunyai pundi-pundi, hendaklah ia membawanya, demikian juga yang mempunyai bekal; dan siapa yang tidak mempunyainya hendaklah ia menjual jubahnya dan membeli pedang.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me has an end.”

block.text: Sebab Aku berkata kepada kamu, bahwa nas Kitab Suci ini harus digenapi pada-Ku: <Ia akan terhitung di antara pemberontak-pemberontak.> Sebab apa yang tertulis tentang Aku sedang digenapi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Kata mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, behold, here are two swords.”

block.text: <<Tuhan, ini dua pedang.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That is enough.”

block.text: <<Sudah cukup.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.

block.text: Lalu pergilah Yesus ke luar kota dan sebagaimana biasa Ia menuju Bukit Zaitun. Murid-murid-Nya juga mengikuti Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was at the place, he said to them,

block.text: Setelah tiba di tempat itu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Pray that you don't enter into temptation.”

block.text: <<Berdoalah supaya kamu jangan jatuh ke dalam pencobaan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was withdrawn from them about a stone's throw, and he knelt down and prayed,
saying,

block.text: Kemudian Ia menjauhkan diri dari mereka kira-kira sepelempar batu jaraknya, lalu Ia berlutut dan berdoa, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”

block.text: <<Ya Bapa-Ku, jikalau Engkau mau, ambillah cawan ini dari pada-Ku; tetapi bukanlah kehendak-Ku, melainkan kehendak-Mulah yang terjadi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.

block.text: Maka seorang malaikat dari langit menampakkan diri kepada-Nya untuk memberi kekuatan kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being in agony he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.

block.text: Ia sangat ketakutan dan makin bersungguh-sungguh berdoa. Peluh-Nya menjadi seperti titik-titik darah yang bertetesan ke tanah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief,
and said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia bangkit dari doa-Nya dan kembali kepada murid-murid-Nya, tetapi Ia mendapati mereka sedang tidur karena dukacita.
Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu tidur? Bangunlah dan berdoalah, supaya kamu jangan jatuh ke dalam pencobaan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.
But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Waktu Yesus masih berbicara datanglah serombongan orang, sedang murid-Nya yang bernama Yudas, seorang dari kedua belas murid itu, berjalan di depan mereka. Yudas mendekati Yesus untuk mencium-Nya.
Maka kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”

block.text: <<Hai Yudas, engkau menyerahkan Anak Manusia dengan ciuman?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him,

block.text: Ketika mereka, yang bersama-sama dengan Yesus, melihat apa yang akan terjadi, berkatalah mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”

block.text: <<Tuhan, mestikah kami menyerang mereka dengan pedang?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and
cut off his right ear.
But Jesus answered,

block.text: Dan seorang dari mereka menyerang hamba Imam Besar sehingga
putus telinga kanannya.
Tetapi Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Permit them to seize me.”

block.text: <<Sudahlah itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and he touched his ear, and healed him.

block.text: Lalu Ia menjamah telinga orang itu dan menyembuhkannya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him,

block.text: Maka Yesus berkata kepada imam-imam kepala dan kepala-kepala pengawal Bait Allah serta tua-tua yang datang untuk menangkap Dia, kata-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?

block.text: <<Sangkamu Aku ini penyamun, maka kamu datang lengkap dengan pedang dan pentung?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn't stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”

block.text: Padahal tiap-tiap hari Aku ada di tengah-tengah kamu di dalam Bait Allah, dan kamu tidak menangkap Aku. Tetapi inilah saat kamu, dan inilah kuasa kegelapan itu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest's house. But Peter followed from a distance.

block.text: Lalu Yesus ditangkap dan dibawa dari tempat itu. Ia digiring ke rumah Imam Besar. Dan Petrus mengikut dari jauh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter sat among them.

block.text: Di tengah-tengah halaman rumah itu orang memasang api dan mereka duduk mengelilinginya. Petrus juga duduk di tengah-tengah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said,

block.text: Seorang hamba perempuan melihat dia duduk dekat api; ia mengamat-amatinya lalu berkata:

block.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man also was with him.”

block.text: <<Juga orang ini bersama-sama dengan Dia.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He denied Jesus, saying,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus menyangkal, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, I don't know him.”

block.text: <<Bukan, aku tidak kenal Dia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After a little while someone else saw him, and said,

block.text: Tidak berapa lama kemudian seorang lain melihat dia lalu berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You also are one of them!”

block.text: <<Engkau juga seorang dari mereka!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter answered,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Man, I am not!”

block.text: <<Bukan, aku tidak!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying,

block.text: Dan kira-kira sejam kemudian seorang lain berkata dengan tegas:

block.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near
ReferenceBlocks.characterIdOverrideForScript: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”

block.text: <<Sungguh, orang ini juga bersama-sama dengan Dia, sebab ia juga orang Galilea.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said,

block.text: Tetapi Petrus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Man, I don't know what you are talking about!”

block.text: <<Bukan, aku tidak tahu apa yang engkau katakan.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

block.text: Seketika itu juga, sementara ia berkata, berkokoklah ayam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord turned, and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord's word, how he said to him,

block.text: Lalu berpalinglah Tuhan memandang Petrus. Maka teringatlah Petrus bahwa Tuhan telah berkata kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<Sebelum ayam berkokok pada hari ini, engkau telah tiga kali menyangkal Aku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out, and wept bitterly.

block.text: Lalu ia pergi ke luar dan menangis dengan sedihnya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.

block.text: Dan orang-orang yang menahan Yesus, mengolok-olokkan Dia dan memukuli-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him,

block.text: Mereka menutupi muka-Nya dan bertanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”

block.text: <<Cobalah katakan siapakah yang memukul Engkau?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.

block.text: Dan banyak lagi hujat yang diucapkan mereka kepada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people was gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,

block.text: Dan setelah hari siang berkumpullah sidang para tua-tua bangsa Yahudi dan imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat, lalu mereka menghadapkan Dia ke Mahkamah Agama mereka,
katanya:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Christ, tell us.”

block.text: <<Jikalau Engkau adalah Mesias, katakanlah kepada kami.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I tell you, you won't believe,
and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.

block.text: <<Sekalipun Aku mengatakannya kepada kamu, namun kamu tidak akan percaya;
dan sekalipun Aku bertanya sesuatu kepada kamu, namun kamu tidak akan menjawab.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”

block.text: Mulai sekarang Anak Manusia sudah duduk di sebelah kanan Allah Yang Mahakuasa.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all said,

block.text: Kata mereka semua:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you then the Son of God?”

block.text: <<Kalau begitu, Engkau ini Anak Allah?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You say it, because I am.”

block.text: <<Kamu sendiri mengatakan, bahwa Akulah Anak Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Lalu kata mereka:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”

block.text: <<Untuk apa kita perlu kesaksian lagi? Kita ini telah mendengarnya dari mulut-Nya sendiri.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 23
The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.

block.text: Lalu bangkitlah seluruh sidang itu dan Yesus dibawa menghadap Pilatus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to accuse him, saying,

block.text: Di situ mereka mulai menuduh Dia, katanya:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”

block.text: <<Telah kedapatan oleh kami, bahwa orang ini menyesatkan bangsa kami, dan melarang membayar pajak kepada Kaisar, dan tentang diri-Nya Ia mengatakan, bahwa Ia adalah Kristus, yaitu Raja.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate asked him,

block.text: Pilatus bertanya kepada-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Engkaukah raja orang Yahudi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered him,

block.text: Jawab Yesus:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes… It is as you say.”

block.text: <<Engkau sendiri mengatakannya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes,

block.text: Kata Pilatus kepada imam-imam kepala dan seluruh orang banyak itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”

block.text: <<Aku tidak mendapati kesalahan apapun pada orang ini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they insisted, saying,

block.text: Tetapi mereka makin kuat mendesak, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.”

block.text: <<Ia menghasut rakyat dengan ajaran-Nya di seluruh Yudea, Ia mulai di Galilea dan sudah sampai ke sini.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked:

block.text: Ketika Pilatus mendengar itu ia bertanya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is this man a Galilean?”

block.text: apakah orang itu seorang Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he found out that he was in Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.

block.text: Dan ketika ia tahu, bahwa Yesus seorang dari wilayah Herodes, ia mengirim Dia menghadap Herodes, yang pada waktu itu ada juga di Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him.

block.text: Ketika Herodes melihat Yesus, ia sangat girang. Sebab sudah lama ia ingin melihat-Nya, karena ia sering mendengar tentang Dia, lagipula ia mengharapkan melihat bagaimana Yesus mengadakan suatu tanda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers.

block.text: Ia mengajukan banyak pertanyaan kepada Yesus, tetapi Yesus tidak memberi jawaban apapun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.

block.text: Sementara itu imam-imam kepala dan ahli-ahli Taurat maju ke depan dan melontarkan tuduhan-tuduhan yang berat terhadap Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.

block.text: Maka mulailah Herodes dan pasukannya menista dan mengolok-olokkan Dia, ia mengenakan jubah kebesaran kepada-Nya lalu mengirim Dia kembali kepada Pilatus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other.

block.text: Dan pada hari itu juga bersahabatlah Herodes dan Pilatus; sebelum itu mereka bermusuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
and said to them,

block.text: Lalu Pilatus mengumpulkan imam-imam kepala dan pemimpin-pemimpin serta rakyat,
dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and see, I have examined him before you, and found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him.

block.text: <<Kamu telah membawa orang ini kepadaku sebagai seorang yang menyesatkan rakyat. Kamu lihat sendiri bahwa aku telah memeriksa-Nya, dan dari kesalahan-kesalahan yang kamu tuduhkan kepada-Nya tidak ada yang kudapati pada-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him.

block.text: Dan Herodes juga tidak, sebab ia mengirimkan Dia kembali kepada kami. Sesungguhnya tidak ada suatu apapun yang dilakukan-Nya yang setimpal dengan hukuman mati.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”

block.text: Jadi aku akan menghajar Dia, lalu melepaskan-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast.
But they all cried out together, saying,

block.text: (Sebab ia wajib melepaskan seorang bagi mereka pada hari raya itu.)
Tetapi mereka berteriak bersama-sama:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!”

block.text: <<Enyahkanlah Dia, lepaskanlah Barabas bagi kami!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder.

block.text: Barabas ini dimasukkan ke dalam penjara berhubung dengan suatu pemberontakan yang telah terjadi di dalam kota dan karena pembunuhan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Pilate spoke to them again, saying:

block.text: Sekali lagi Pilatus berbicara dengan suara keras kepada mereka,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why not release Jesus?”

block.text: karena ia ingin melepaskan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but they shouted, saying,
