block.text: Tetapi mereka berteriak membalasnya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Salibkanlah Dia! Salibkanlah Dia!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them the third time,

block.text: Kata Pilatus untuk ketiga kalinya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.”

block.text: <<Kejahatan apa yang sebenarnya telah dilakukan orang ini? Tidak ada suatu kesalahanpun yang kudapati pada-Nya, yang setimpal dengan hukuman mati. Jadi aku akan menghajar Dia, lalu melepaskan-Nya.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they shouted all the more, saying:

block.text: Tetapi dengan berteriak mereka mendesak dan menuntut,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

block.text: supaya Ia disalibkan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed.
Pilate said:

block.text: dan akhirnya mereka menang dengan teriak mereka.
Lalu Pilatus memutuskan,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will do what you ask.”

block.text: supaya tuntutan mereka dikabulkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He released Barrabus, the prisoner they asked for. He had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder. Then Pilate gave Jesus to them, saying:

block.text: Dan ia melepaskan orang yang dimasukkan ke dalam penjara karena pemberontakan dan pembunuhan itu sesuai dengan tuntutan mereka, tetapi Yesus diserahkannya kepada mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do what you want with him.”

block.text: untuk diperlakukan semau-maunya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it after Jesus.

block.text: Ketika mereka membawa Yesus, mereka menahan seorang yang bernama Simon dari Kirene, yang baru datang dari luar kota, lalu diletakkan salib itu di atas bahunya, supaya dipikulnya sambil mengikuti Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.
But Jesus, turning to them, said,

block.text: Sejumlah besar orang mengikuti Dia; di antaranya banyak perempuan yang menangisi dan meratapi Dia.
Yesus berpaling kepada mereka dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughters of Jerusalem, don't weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.

block.text: <<Hai puteri-puteri Yerusalem, janganlah kamu menangisi Aku, melainkan tangisilah dirimu sendiri dan anak-anakmu!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’

block.text: Sebab lihat, akan tiba masanya orang berkata: <Berbahagialah perempuan mandul dan yang rahimnya tidak pernah melahirkan, dan yang susunya tidak pernah menyusui.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’

block.text: Maka orang akan mulai berkata kepada gunung-gunung: <Runtuhlah menimpa kami!> dan kepada bukit-bukit: <Timbunilah kami!>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if they do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

block.text: Sebab jikalau orang berbuat demikian dengan kayu hidup, apakah yang akan terjadi dengan kayu kering?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.

block.text: Dan ada juga digiring dua orang lain, yaitu dua penjahat untuk dihukum mati bersama-sama dengan Dia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to the place that is called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.
Jesus said,

block.text: Ketika mereka sampai di tempat yang bernama Tengkorak, mereka menyalibkan Yesus di situ dan juga kedua orang penjahat itu, yang seorang di sebelah kanan-Nya dan yang lain di sebelah kiri-Nya.
Yesus berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, forgive them, for they don't know what they are doing.”

block.text: <<Ya Bapa, ampunilah mereka, sebab mereka tidak tahu apa yang mereka perbuat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.

block.text: Dan mereka membuang undi untuk membagi pakaian-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying,

block.text: Orang banyak berdiri di situ dan melihat semuanya. Pemimpin-pemimpin mengejek Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”

block.text: <<Orang lain Ia selamatkan, biarlah sekarang Ia menyelamatkan diri-Nya sendiri, jika Ia adalah Mesias, orang yang dipilih Allah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,
and saying,

block.text: Juga prajurit-prajurit mengolok-olokkan Dia; mereka mengunjukkan anggur asam kepada-Nya
dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”

block.text: <<Jika Engkau adalah raja orang Yahudi, selamatkanlah diri-Mu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

block.text: Ada juga tulisan di atas kepala-Nya: INILAH RAJA ORANG YAHUDI.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying,

block.text: Seorang dari penjahat yang di gantung itu menghujat Dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”

block.text: <<Bukankah Engkau adalah Kristus? Selamatkanlah diri-Mu dan kami!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the other answered, and rebuking him said,

block.text: Tetapi yang seorang menegor dia, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?

block.text: <<Tidakkah engkau takut, juga tidak kepada Allah, sedang engkau menerima hukuman yang sama?

ReferenceBlocks.text: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”

block.text: Kita memang selayaknya dihukum, sebab kita menerima balasan yang setimpal dengan perbuatan kita, tetapi orang ini tidak berbuat sesuatu yang salah.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to Jesus,

block.text: Lalu ia berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.”

block.text: <<Yesus, ingatlah akan aku, apabila Engkau datang sebagai Raja.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Kata Yesus kepadanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”

block.text: <<Aku berkata kepadamu, sesungguhnya hari ini juga engkau akan ada bersama-sama dengan Aku di dalam Firdaus.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.

block.text: Ketika itu hari sudah kira-kira jam dua belas, lalu kegelapan meliputi seluruh daerah itu sampai jam tiga,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.

block.text: sebab matahari tidak bersinar. Dan tabir Bait Suci terbelah dua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said,

block.text: Lalu Yesus berseru dengan suara nyaring:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!”

block.text: <<Ya Bapa, ke dalam tangan-Mu Kuserahkan nyawa-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having said this, he breathed his last.

block.text: Dan sesudah berkata demikian Ia menyerahkan nyawa-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying,

block.text: Ketika kepala pasukan melihat apa yang terjadi, ia memuliakan Allah, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Certainly this was a righteous man.”

block.text: <<Sungguh, orang ini adalah orang benar!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their breasts.

block.text: Dan sesudah seluruh orang banyak, yang datang berkerumun di situ untuk tontonan itu, melihat apa yang terjadi itu, pulanglah mereka sambil memukul-mukul diri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All his acquaintances, and the women who followed with him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.

block.text: Semua orang yang mengenal Yesus dari dekat, termasuk perempuan-perempuan yang mengikuti Dia dari Galilea, berdiri jauh-jauh dan melihat semuanya itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there was a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man.

block.text: Adalah seorang yang bernama Yusuf. Ia anggota Majelis Besar, dan seorang yang baik lagi benar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (He had not consented to their counsel and deed). He was from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, and he was also waiting for the Kingdom of God:

block.text: Ia tidak setuju dengan putusan dan tindakan Majelis itu. Ia berasal dari Arimatea, sebuah kota Yahudi dan ia menanti-nantikan Kerajaan Allah.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.

block.text: Ia pergi menghadap Pilatus dan meminta mayat Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid.

block.text: Dan sesudah ia menurunkan mayat itu, ia mengapaninya dengan kain lenan, lalu membaringkannya di dalam kubur yang digali di dalam bukit batu, di mana belum pernah dibaringkan mayat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.

block.text: Hari itu adalah hari persiapan dan sabat hampir mulai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and saw the tomb, and how his body was laid.

block.text: Dan perempuan-perempuan yang datang bersama-sama dengan Yesus dari Galilea, ikut serta dan mereka melihat kubur itu dan bagaimana mayat-Nya dibaringkan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They returned, and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.

block.text: Dan setelah pulang, mereka menyediakan rempah-rempah dan minyak mur. Dan pada hari Sabat mereka beristirahat menurut hukum Taurat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 24
But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.

block.text: tetapi pagi-pagi benar pada hari pertama minggu itu mereka pergi ke kubur membawa rempah-rempah yang telah disediakan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

block.text: Mereka mendapati batu sudah terguling dari kubur itu,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They entered in, and didn't find the Lord Jesus’ body.

block.text: dan setelah masuk mereka tidak menemukan mayat Tuhan Yesus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were greatly perplexed about this and said:

block.text: Mereka sangat bingung tentang hal ini dan berkata:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is his body?”

block.text: "Di mana tubuhnya?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.
Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them,

block.text: tiba-tiba ada dua orang berdiri dekat mereka memakai pakaian yang berkilau-kilauan.
Mereka sangat ketakutan dan menundukkan kepala, tetapi kedua orang itu berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you seek the living among the dead?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu mencari Dia yang hidup, di antara orang mati?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He isn't here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee:

block.text: Ia tidak ada di sini, Ia telah bangkit. Ingatlah apa yang dikatakan-Nya kepada kamu, ketika Ia masih di Galilea,

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”

block.text: yaitu bahwa <Anak Manusia harus diserahkan ke tangan orang-orang berdosa dan disalibkan, dan akan bangkit pada hari yang ketiga.> >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After hearing these words, the women said to each other:

block.text: Maka teringatlah mereka

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you remember what he said?”

block.text: akan perkataan Yesus itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.

block.text: Dan setelah mereka kembali dari kubur, mereka menceriterakan semuanya itu kepada kesebelas murid dan kepada semua saudara yang lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.

block.text: Perempuan-perempuan itu ialah Maria dari Magdala, dan Yohana, dan Maria ibu Yakobus. Dan perempuan-perempuan lain juga yang bersama-sama dengan mereka memberitahukannya kepada rasul-rasul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn't believe them.

block.text: Tetapi bagi mereka perkataan-perkataan itu seakan-akan omong kosong dan mereka tidak percaya kepada perempuan-perempuan itu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.

block.text: Sungguhpun demikian Petrus bangun, lalu cepat-cepat pergi ke kubur itu. Ketika ia menjenguk ke dalam, ia melihat hanya kain kapan saja. Lalu ia pergi, dan ia bertanya dalam hatinya apa yang kiranya telah terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.

block.text: Pada hari itu juga dua orang dari murid-murid Yesus pergi ke sebuah kampung bernama Emaus, yang terletak kira-kira tujuh mil jauhnya dari Yerusalem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.

block.text: dan mereka bercakap-cakap tentang segala sesuatu yang telah terjadi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, while they talked and questioned together, that Jesus himself came near, and went with them.

block.text: Ketika mereka sedang bercakap-cakap dan bertukar pikiran, datanglah Yesus sendiri mendekati mereka, lalu berjalan bersama-sama dengan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
He said to them,

block.text: Tetapi ada sesuatu yang menghalangi mata mereka, sehingga mereka tidak dapat mengenal Dia.
Yesus berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you talking about as you walk?”

block.text: <<Apakah yang kamu percakapkan sementara kamu berjalan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were very sad.
One of them, named Cleopas, answered him,

block.text: Maka berhentilah mereka dengan muka muram.
Seorang dari mereka, namanya Kleopas, menjawab-Nya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn't know the things which have happened there in these days?”

block.text: <<Adakah Engkau satu-satunya orang asing di Yerusalem, yang tidak tahu apa yang terjadi di situ pada hari-hari belakangan ini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What things?”

block.text: <<Apakah itu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Jawab mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The things concerning Jesus, the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;

block.text: <<Apa yang terjadi dengan Yesus orang Nazaret. Dia adalah seorang nabi, yang berkuasa dalam pekerjaan dan perkataan di hadapan Allah dan di depan seluruh bangsa kami.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and they crucified him.

block.text: Tetapi imam-imam kepala dan pemimpin-pemimpin kami telah menyerahkan Dia untuk dihukum mati dan mereka telah menyalibkan-Nya.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.

block.text: Padahal kami dahulu mengharapkan, bahwa Dialah yang datang untuk membebaskan bangsa Israel. Tetapi sementara itu telah lewat tiga hari, sejak semuanya itu terjadi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb.

block.text: <<Tetapi beberapa perempuan dari kalangan kami telah mengejutkan kami: Pagi-pagi buta mereka telah pergi ke kubur,

ReferenceBlocks.text: And when they didn't find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.

block.text: dan tidak menemukan mayat-Nya. Lalu mereka datang dengan berita, bahwa telah kelihatan kepada mereka malaikat-malaikat, yang mengatakan, bahwa Ia hidup.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just like the women had said, but they didn't see him.”

block.text: Dan beberapa teman kami telah pergi ke kubur itu dan mendapati, bahwa memang benar yang dikatakan perempuan-perempuan itu, tetapi Dia tidak mereka lihat.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!

block.text: <<Hai kamu orang bodoh, betapa lambannya hatimu, sehingga kamu tidak percaya segala sesuatu, yang telah dikatakan para nabi!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Didn't the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?”

block.text: Bukankah Mesias harus menderita semuanya itu untuk masuk ke dalam kemuliaan-Nya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.

block.text: Lalu Ia menjelaskan kepada mereka apa yang tertulis tentang Dia dalam seluruh Kitab Suci, mulai dari kitab-kitab Musa dan segala kitab nabi-nabi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They drew near to the village, where they were going, and he acted like he would go further.
They urged him, saying,

block.text: Mereka mendekati kampung yang mereka tuju, lalu Ia berbuat seolah-olah hendak meneruskan perjalanan-Nya.
Tetapi mereka sangat mendesak-Nya, katanya:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.”

block.text: <<Tinggallah bersama-sama dengan kami, sebab hari telah menjelang malam dan matahari hampir terbenam.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went in to stay with them.

block.text: Lalu masuklah Ia untuk tinggal bersama-sama dengan mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that when he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave to them.

block.text: Waktu Ia duduk makan dengan mereka, Ia mengambil roti, mengucap berkat, lalu memecah-mecahkannya dan memberikannya kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.

block.text: Ketika itu terbukalah mata mereka dan merekapun mengenal Dia, tetapi Ia lenyap dari tengah-tengah mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said one to another,

block.text: Kata mereka seorang kepada yang lain:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Weren't our hearts burning within us, while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?”

block.text: <<Bukankah hati kita berkobar-kobar, ketika Ia berbicara dengan kita di tengah jalan dan ketika Ia menerangkan Kitab Suci kepada kita?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,
saying,

block.text: Lalu bangunlah mereka dan terus kembali ke Yerusalem. Di situ mereka mendapati kesebelas murid itu. Mereka sedang berkumpul bersama-sama dengan teman-teman mereka.
Kata mereka itu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”

block.text: <<Sesungguhnya Tuhan telah bangkit dan telah menampakkan diri kepada Simon.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.

block.text: Lalu kedua orang itupun menceriterakan apa yang terjadi di tengah jalan dan bagaimana mereka mengenal Dia pada waktu Ia memecah-mecahkan roti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them,

block.text: Dan sementara mereka bercakap-cakap tentang hal-hal itu, Yesus tiba-tiba berdiri di tengah-tengah mereka dan berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: <<Damai sejahtera bagi kamu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
He said to them,

block.text: Mereka terkejut dan takut dan menyangka bahwa mereka melihat hantu.
Akan tetapi Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?

block.text: <<Mengapa kamu terkejut dan apa sebabnya timbul keragu-raguan di dalam hati kamu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn't have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”

block.text: Lihatlah tangan-Ku dan kaki-Ku: Aku sendirilah ini; rabalah Aku dan lihatlah, karena hantu tidak ada daging dan tulangnya, seperti yang kamu lihat ada pada-Ku.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.

block.text: Sambil berkata demikian, Ia memperlihatkan tangan dan kaki-Nya kepada mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they still didn't believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them,

block.text: Dan ketika mereka belum percaya karena girangnya dan masih heran, berkatalah Ia kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you have anything here to eat?”

block.text: <<Adakah padamu makanan di sini?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.

block.text: Lalu mereka memberikan kepada-Nya sepotong ikan goreng.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them, and ate in front of them.
He said to them,

block.text: Ia mengambilnya dan memakannya di depan mata mereka.
Ia berkata kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is what I told you, while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me must be fulfilled.”

block.text: <<Inilah perkataan-Ku, yang telah Kukatakan kepadamu ketika Aku masih bersama-sama dengan kamu, yakni bahwa harus digenapi semua yang ada tertulis tentang Aku dalam kitab Taurat Musa dan kitab nabi-nabi dan kitab Mazmur.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.
He said to them,

block.text: Lalu Ia membuka pikiran mereka, sehingga mereka mengerti Kitab Suci.
Kata-Nya kepada mereka:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Thus it is written: The Christ will suffer and will rise from the dead the third day.

block.text: <<Ada tertulis demikian: Mesias harus menderita dan bangkit dari antara orang mati pada hari yang ketiga,

ReferenceBlocks.text: And repentance and the remission of sins will be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

block.text: dan lagi: dalam nama-Nya berita tentang pertobatan dan pengampunan dosa harus disampaikan kepada segala bangsa, mulai dari Yerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are witnesses of these things.

block.text: Kamu adalah saksi dari semuanya ini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I send forth what my Father has promised you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”

block.text: Dan Aku akan mengirim kepadamu apa yang dijanjikan Bapa-Ku. Tetapi kamu harus tinggal di dalam kota ini sampai kamu diperlengkapi dengan kekuasaan dari tempat tinggi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

block.text: Lalu Yesus membawa mereka ke luar kota sampai dekat Betania. Di situ Ia mengangkat tangan-Nya dan memberkati mereka.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, while he blessed them, that he withdrew from them, and was carried up into heaven.

block.text: Dan ketika Ia sedang memberkati mereka, Ia berpisah dari mereka dan terangkat ke sorga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They worshiped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

block.text: Mereka sujud menyembah kepada-Nya, lalu mereka pulang ke Yerusalem dengan sangat bersukacita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

block.text: Mereka senantiasa berada di dalam Bait Allah dan memuliakan Allah.
